Spaghettini Tossed with Sautéed Organic Cherry Tomatoes, Fresh Basil, Tomato Sauce and Parmesan Cheese

It was a little tasteless, the chicken was dry. I wish I would have chosen something different. Maybe next time.

The upside is this place is open 24-7.

The waitress was extremely nice, attentive and quick!  We also got our food very quickly. We came here around 6:30-7:00 and had been seated right away, so I'm sure it's safe o say you don't need a reservation.

This is my favorite place to order Huevos Rancheros. I like that it's made with crispy tortillas and every thing about it is delicious. The very best I have had. The sauce is outstanding! This is not an ordinary Huevos Rancheros. Not typical at all. Try it. Even the employees rave about it.

Had dinner here for the first time last night before the Styx + Dan Felder show at the Venetian and was pleasantly surprised. Wait time was minimal although the hostess staff should have used the beepers\/buzzers as it gets loud in the waiting area and it was hard to hear your name being called, got seated and waitstaff was efficient from the beginning! Menu is large so it takes time to look it over. We ordered the following:

Korean Sriracha Burger
Kalbi Marinated Beef, Shiitake Mushrooms, Onion and Sesame Seeds on Top of Our Burger with Sriracha Mayo

Cajun Shrimp & Chicken Jambalaya
Sauteed with Peppers, Onions and Tasso in a Delicious Spicy Sauce. Served with White Rice

Delicious and we will definitely be back for more.
This review is based on the potato stuffed wraps and the calamari...if I had to chose between the two, potatoe wraps all the way!

If you've got a hankering for breakfast at 2am and don't mind heading to The Venetian, then Grand Lux Cafe is the place to be.

Bacon, eggs, hash browns, and toast may sound drab, but when cooked to perfection it's nothing short of amazing (for your tastebuds at least).

Craving for something sweeter? Belgian waffles with whipped cream and a side of strawberries should do the trick. 

Yeah, they have other items on the menu, but after trying a wide variety of entrees, their breakfast choices are by far the most satisfying.

Ah, grand lux is gonna forever remind me of some good times in vegas. Me and my friends came here at 2am-ish friday night (or saturday morning i should say) after a long drunken night out. I really like that it's open all the time, that its right next to the elevators up to the rooms and that we didn't have to wait very long for seating. We ordered the calamari, some kind of sandwich and spinach artichoke dip. The calamari tasted soooo gooood, spinach artichoke dip was really good, and I dont remember much about the sandwich but I'm sure it was fine. 

We came here saturday night too, also after a long night out. This time we came with 12 girls so we had to wait a little longer for seating but it was still pretty fast (also probably because it was 2-3am in the morning). Our table split chicken and waffles, calamari (yes again because it was so good) , some kind of pizza and some other dish with egg or something but I didn't get to try it. Everything was pretty good from what I can remember. I think we ordered maybe 7 dishes in total and the bill came out to 100 something dollars.

If you do go there, I'd say get calamari for sure because its really delicious (cant go wrong with fried stuff). Spinach artichoke dip was also really good but I think its usually good no matter where you get it. Chicken and waffle (one big waffle) were just eh. Grand Lux is affiliated with cheesecake factory and I can see why, it really does remind me of a more expensive cheesecake factory. But still, if youre staying at the venetian, its a great convenient place to go after a night out.
The mimosas here are generous and the breakfast selection is great. Being on the casino floor means tables closer to the entrance get a waft of nicotine from time to time.

I love this place.  Quality abounds.  It makes me smile when people write that the association with Cheesecake Factory is bad.  Why is that?  With Cheesecake, you are guaranteed a reasonable experience with good food, enormous portions, and competitive prices.  Grand Lux is no different, AND the restaurant has a better menu.  

People love their star chefs and fancy restaurants.  Maybe they live in parts of the United States where access is difficult and cannot compare the LV versions to the originals.  In my experience, they are often poor renditions or ghosts if you will, of their original versions (e.g. Craftsteak MGM vs. NY, Daniel Wynn vs. NY, and Bouchon Venetian vs. Napa).   The quality of food and service doesn't translate to Las Vegas, and I think the majority of people agree with me here.

But you can't say the same thing with Grand Lux.  It is a super-sized version of the Cheescake Factory; same decor but with better service and seating.  Wait-time is low, and the food gets served rather quickly.  Food quality is what you've come to expect - moderate to high. 

Grand Lux in the Palazzo is the best "coffeeshop" in a casino.

While our orders took a while, it was nice to see what people ordered. I wanted to get something extra special and when I saw the Grand Lux Cafe French toast which is made of EXTRA thick slices of Brioche Bread, I knew I had to get it. The toast is so massive that the waiter even had to ask me if the size of the French toast was okay. I thought that was rather odd but I happily said I was okay with that. Helloooo, more food the better because that means leftovers!
The cappuccino was disappointing. It was bubbly, not foamy.

The last few times they've disappointed.  They do not have as good of service compared to when they opened, over 10 years ago.  Also they have smaller portion sizes..... They really don't have the level of quality control that they once had, either.  

And they are not getting any cheaper.  I'm all for the same food and a more expensive menu. But when the food quality and consistency drops and then the price goes up.... that is bad business.

We've stopped recommending them as we once did.  Years past we'd  tell everyone they had to go but now we don't.  

Hopefully, they revert back to the good times.

PS~ this review is for the original Grand Lux Cafe in the Venetian.  Not the newer one.

Came here just for dessert. The bread pudding wasn't bad. It had very little egg in it but the caramel made up for it. The gluten free Godiva chocolate cheese cake was a little too greasy for my liking. It could be more cheesy. The entrees on the other tables looked rather large so the portions are generous here and the price is reasonable.

Well there are two Grand Lux.. one at the Venettian and Palazzo...
The new one at the Palazzo is better.
good food. good price..
nothing much else to say..
Food was not good! Too salt. There is a lot of other places with better food for better price. On the plus side the bread they gave was good. Meal size was decent.

I went in for the breakfast and I had the best customer service. I will always visit this restaurant because there are so many delicious entrées and we are always given excellent customer service. Great waiting staff
Quick spot to get lunch during the Conf Cobb salad with Margarita

A solid brunch choice in Vegas. You can tell that Cheesecake Factory plays a role in the food & decor. Service was quick and the food was good. I was feeling gross from all of the unhealthy food I ate the day before so I ordered the protein breakfast. Great, healthy option...sometimes you need that after a night out. There is a breakfast buffet until 11 but since we were seated at 10:45 it didn't seem worth it. My friend ordered hashbrowns, eggs and sausage. The sausage was the best, not too greasy. 2 entrees + drinks = $40. I thought that was very reasonable.

The Grand Lux Cafe knows how to make a great meal.  I've eaten here several times and each time has been perfect.  

The food is always incredible and the staff is amazing.  I believe they are open 24\/7 and they have a large menu of options to choose from.

You really can't go wrong with anything you choose, I highly recommend Grand Lux Cafe.

Last time I came here, we had a feast.  We ate pizza and some other items.  They were so good.  This time I decided to eat more "healthier."  We started off our meal with the bread.  It's always good when hungry and free.  I got the Chicken Salad Sandwich.  I didn't like how the chicken came.  It reminded me of eating tuna, and the sauce they used to moisten the food sucked.  I also ate (off my friend's plate) the breakfast sausage, hash browns, and egg meal.  It was alright.
A better version of cheesecake factory. I had some pizza and pasta. It was tasty.

I've only eaten here once, so I don't consider my opinion the most valued or educated.  However, I can say that when I ate here a while back the food was fantastic.  The portions were huge, as is consistent with the Cheesecake Factory, which is in someway affiliated with the Grand Lux (again, not the most educated review).  I ordered the fried chicken and waffles.  It was basically a belgian waffle with chicken fingers over top of it, but the food made my night.  The bread they serve as an appetizer is also pretty delicious.  Overall, a great dining experience.  I can't remember the name of my server, or anything in particular from that aspect of the meal, which is usually a good thing.
We always eat breakfast here and love the omlettes.  Lots of fresh fruit and healthy food to get your day started!  Love it!

Why two star? Bc of the food? No. Bc of the wait to get seated? No.

This was my 17th trip to Vegas and about my 8th eating but overall the worst service I've ever ever ever had in LV.

To preface the boring story, me and my girlfriend are the EASIEST people to wait on. We don't ask lots of questions, we start with please and end with thank you, and we never give the wait staff a hard time with anything, ever.

We ordered two iced teas, sliders, and mashed potato "egg" rolls. Hey, it's 1am. Anyways we get our drinks, ok. But he never comes back to refill them.... ever! We finished them before our meals. He brings the food and I guess it's my fault I didn't ask for more... the dry cups weren't a sign. Nonetheless he drops off the food and disappears into the night like a caped crusader. Meanwhile he waits on the table directly next to us. He 1. Didn't refill the drinks. 2. Asked if we needed condiments 3. Check back at all. 4. Didn't bring the bill or clear the plates until I nicely got his attention. He earned a $2.25 tip on a $30 check. I'd never ever ever tip under 18% ever ever but this guy was shit. I shouldn't have to ask for a refill. You bring my food, you see it's empty, and you refill it... like their been doing the last 200 years. You at least should check up on us once. You didn't. You suck. Do not pass go and do not collect 20%.

I blame the ass waiter not the restaurant. It's the first time I received poor service here.

Worst meal in Vegas. Food was alright, the 1 star is for service. Terrible service from the start to the finish. The server did not write down the order, forgot our drinks, after we reminded about the drinks, she messes up one of omelette orders. What was appalling was that our server did not even acknowledge that there was a mistake. Servers like these make restaurants look really bad. Hope you can find better servers.

Late-night meal fix (and I mean MEAL) with an extensive menu. 

I don't understand why but there's only one guy working the front when the demand is clearly high. This means we waited about half an hour for our food.

But we were hungry at 4am. 

The burger my friend had boasted a patty that was an inch thick. At least. Another friend ordered a shrimp scampi with scarily large shrimp and my omelet had a 10-inch diameter...and we ate it all.

Delicious but the wait during such a crucial time of need resulted in the docking off of 2 stars. Oh and it's pretty expensive for drunk munchies. 

Pro tip: The premade sandwiches are freaking DELICIOUS and only about $7, which is the best deal on their menu.

I go here at least once everytime I'm at the Venetian. Their prices are good (for Vegas), services is great, and food is high quality. I'll had the BBQ Cedar Plank Salmon more than once. I know that it sounds like a kinda-strange dish, but if you just like fish (not love fish) I think you've find this dish to your liking! It's moist and smokey. You'll find the BBQ sauce a nice flavorful touch. Lastly, they open at 6AM so check them out for breakfast instead of the cheap buffet or stale coffee shop.

So, this is a Cheesecake Factory. They even admit it's by the same people. I'm not familiar with what CF offers to compare the menus, but I will say this is a fine lunch spot. At the recommendation of a friend, we had the Buffalo Egg Rolls...which are awesome. Buffalo chicken fried in to an egg roll and served with bleu cheese dressing? Yes, please.

After that, I had a kind of tropical salad, which was good, but not great. The chicken was kind of tasteless, needed a little seasoning, and the dressing was way too sweet. It was served with a nice mix of lettuce, jicama, bell peppers, sweet peas, and other veggies, but it didn't need to be drowned in all that sweet dressing. The fried flour tortilla chips served on the side were drenched in the stuff, which made them like eating sopapillas.

Price was...not appalling for being inside a casino, and service was friendly. I would probably go back for the buffalo egg rolls, but there are definitely more exciting spots to be had.

This place had great service and everything was quick and fast with the refills on the bread and on the drinks, which is awesome and what I expect when I'm in Vegas ! :) 

The food though isn't that great in my opinion. I had the Miso Glazed Salmon because I wasn't feeling good at the time and didn't feel like eating lots of beef and heavy meat soo I ordered the salmon. 

The dish was soo huge and the piece of fish was gigantic, so big I took only a few bites and I was done!! I should of shared with someone which was downfall. 

If you want to eat here, you should have a really big appetite !!

I'm giving Grand Lux a 4 star rating mainly for being at the right place and at the right time. That place and time was for a late night snack after drinking and running around the strip.

The food and price is good. Not amazing, but it's basically Cheesecake Factory. So expect that quality.

The real trick is that they have take out next door. So.... After about 1:30am in Vegas, we all know either food joints shut down or they have huge lines. And grand luxe did. So maybe I'm reviewing the wrong place, but I know the food was from grand lux.

Next door n the little cafe, you can order take out. And they have a perfect selection of perfectly creamy and satisfying pastas. 

Pasta carbonara is always a winner. They'll load you up. You can feed one very hungry and drunk man. Two small drunk men and prob three to four small .... Kids?

They load you up with bread too.

We were done showering, eating comfortably in pj's in our room while our friends just finally got seated at the oyster bar over at imperial station.... Which I might add... We drove back from because the wait was so long...

I love this place. It's owned by the same people as the Cheesecake Factory. I always go when I need a coffee pick me up and get the caramel macchiato. I also like to go for happy hour and get the sangria blanco. It's absolutely delightful and refreshing.

Grand Lux is also the perfect place to go after a long night of gambling or clubbing. It's open 24 hours and the portions are huge! Great for groups so you can share and everything is very affordable.

As other reviews has stated, this place bears a strong resemblance to the Cheesecake Factory. The restaurant itself is quite large, so even during the dinner rush we were seated within 5mins of putting our names down. Once we were seated, we spent  a good 10mins going through the pages and pages of the menu. Luckily, they served warm bread & butter to munch on while deciding on what to eat. 

We all ended up choosing a 'medium plates', which was actually still too big for any of us to finish. My housemade pierogies were so delicious! Light, fluffy potato dumplings served on top of braised short ribs & mushrooms.. mmm. I also tried a bit of the kobe (softball-sized) meatballs in the creamy cheesy polenta which were also great. Our appetizer of wings were also moist inside with a nice crunchy exterior. Yum! Considering how much food they give, the prices are definitely reasonable and they are open 24\/7, which is perfect for everyone in Vegas!

I really like this place! 

If you go in here and noticed the resemblance of the Grand Lux Cafe and CheeseCake Factroy, it is not a coincidence! They are sisters, sisters! Owned by the same people!

I ate here in January 2010 & went back on August 2010.
We went here on Thursday night and Friday morning too!

Everything that I've tried there is so good.


We love the crispy chicken flautas, you will find them under the things to share category, those flautas are HUGE! I'm thinking like 9 inches long. You get four of those per order so with 1 -2 you are done! So don't be stingy and share!

I also got to tried some pasta, I forget what it was called, but it was delicious!

They have great burgers also! I used to be grossed out about medium rare meat, but I was wrong! That's the best, it brings out the flavor and juices of the meat.

We also ordered the half chicken salad sandwich, salad and soup-
-The Salad was delicious
-Asparagus soup was the best, I've ever tried
-The sandwich, good but I wouldn't order it again. 

Highly Recommended :) 

Will I go back here? HELL YEAH!

This is my go to place for late night food in Vegas. 
They used to have a grand Lux Café in LA but I heard it shut down, so sad.

I like the location inside the Venetian better than the one in the Palazzo but the food is just as good at both. 

They have great bread,  good omelettes refreshing ass Arnold Palmer's. The patty melt is good all of the sandwiches are great. The grilled cheese with pulled pork is yummy as well as the Santa Barbara chicken sandwich. They have those amazing cafe fries that are crispy but soft at the same time. 

BUT, The most amazing thing they have in their Encyclopedia like menu are the burgers. Holy shit their burgers are bomb. Outrageously good!!!!

Add bacon, cheese, avocado, crispy onions, add mushrooms, add pulled pork, add anything to it and it's going to be delicious!!!!! Man it sucks that I can't get one in Los Angeles anymore. But one of these when you're drunk or even sober is out of this world!!!

Also David was our server last time and he had such a great attitude for working the overnight shift dealing with a bunch of drunks, lol 
Great service from him!

For rise to be a sister of the cheese cake factory I was surprised with prices. They are affordable!  The only don't side is that is inside a Casio but the service was phenomenal. The waitress came to check on us serval time and made sure that everything was up to par. Sadly her shift was over before we finished our meal, I would've love to have left her a tip.

This place was great!
We went here for brunch and we're seated immediately. The decor and ambiance in this place was spectacular! 
The food came quick, hot and in giant portions! 
Highly recommended for a bang for the buck value as well as quality.

I came here on a Friday around 4pm with three friends after a long drive up to Vegas from LA. We were seated as soon as we walked through the door, and waters, and bread quickly came our way, which were much appreciated since we were famished. 

After a quick peek at the appetizer section of the menu we placed an order for some Buffalo Chicken Rolls, and by the time those suckers arrived we were able to decide what we wanted for our main course. I opted for the Lunch Special Pasta and Salad with the Pasta Telephono. But more on that later. The Buffalo Chicken Rolls (which came with 6 pieces) were crispy on the outside, and warm, gooey, cheesy, and buffalo-y on the inside. Plus they weren't too filling. So we had plenty of room for our entrees. 

Just as we polished off our appetizer, our lunch entrees arrived. And they were HUGE. The side salad was pretty standard. But the pasta was cheesy (notice a theme here?), well-cooked, and tasty. It was basically an adult mac n cheese. And it was so gigantic that I had enough leftover for a late night snack. 

And, best of all, the bill came to under $20 per person. It was so very reasonable, especially in Vegas where everything is overpriced. I suggest checking this place out: it'll give you the most grub for your buck (except for maybe a buffet).

This place is pretty much the Cheesecake Factory; I'm not sure what's the difference (especially since it's the sister restaurant) except the fact it's open 24 hours haha.

We went here around 3 AM, after the club of course. We ordered a chicken strips, a burger and some shrimp scampi, as well as more drinks hehehe. As expected, the food was served in huge portions and was very filling, but they were pretty good overall! We kinda spent too much but whatever, it's Vegas, you have to accept the high prices when you travel here.

Also shoutout to our waitress for taking care of our buzzy selves, and still getting the staff to sing me happy birthday with some cheesecake! I wish I remembered your name, but I remembered the moment :) haha.

Good stuff! Nicely decorated in a Cheesecake Factory-esque way. The food was tasty. Service was friendly. I had the Cuban sandwich with prosciutto and roasted pork. It was very tasty and not dry. The fries were crispy with a nice soft center. The waiter was nice and brought me my requested array of fry condiments. My wife had the chicken salad sandwich and it was tasty as well. Not too inundated with mayo. A good place for sure. Sad we missed their brunch buffet - next time.

Summary: Fantastic!  Better than I remembered of the one in Beverly Hills.  Great food, selection, service, and value.  Nothing to complain about; only compliments.

My buddy and I were in town for CES and in need of a no-reservations-needed dinner at around 8pm on a Friday.  I had been to the Beverly Hills Grand Lux numerous times in years past and always enjoyed it, but it never really stood out as a great restaurant to me.  When I called this Grand Lux there was no wait time, so we made our way there from Caesar's and were immediately seated.

We ordered a couple of drinks (I ordered the house Chardonnay, which was by Beringer and was a great deal at $7 and really good), looked over the menu and decided to share a few items.  The three we chose were:

Short rib sliders - Four little sliders on brioche buns, stuffed with super tender and flavorful braised short rib and topped with a creamy horseradish sauce.  Fantastic!

Avocado-Chipotle Cheeseburger - A pretty massive cheeseburger.  Messy and kind of hard to eat, but with delicious ingredients.  A nice kick, too.

Spicy Carnitas Sandwich - An excellent mix of textures and flavors.  Crisp on the outside and super tender on the inside.  A great sauce was provided with this one and it was delicious.

Each of the entrees came with a side salad, so for around $35 we had a great quality meal and were satisfied with the quantity of food, too.  Can't recommend this place enough.
Great food! Our service was excellent from Pierre. It's quite reasonable for Vegas, but still high for the real world.

The Grand Luxe is the breakfast spot in the Venetian (and there is one in the Palazzo).

The food is meh and the service is worse. It wasn't terrible food - both days I ordered some pretty easy breakfast fare (eggs, bacon, etc) and my wife did too (pancakes, eggs). The service was super slow and the food was not cheap. 

We didn't try the buffet.

I'd recommend room service. We had a much better breakfast via room service in the hotel and it was cheaper or just as expensive even including the service charges.

The only shining star of the Grand Luxe was their coffee. It was great, smooth and not bitter.

Good stuff at the Grand Lux!
A group of us, maybe a dozen or so, ended up here for lunch the other day, and it was great! I had the BBQ Pork Sandwich and it was amazing! Could have come with a few more fries, but no complaints. Food came pretty fast, and we were able to relax and enjoy our meal and chat.

Went here for the first time during Labor Day Weekend. Portions are huge! I got the flatbread with salad. YUMM, hit the spot after a drunken Friday night. I wish I had room for the cheesecake. Definitely going to be on my list to go here for food when I go back to Vegas for Halloween.
Try the chicken and waffles late night after all of your fun!! You won't regret. Plus the Venetian is fun to explore while you're there.

This cafe is just as good as The Cheesecake Factory given that they are both sister restaurants. It's a good place to come to after-hours when all you want to do is eat to avoid a hangover the next day! 

A group of my friends and I went and didn't have to wait too long. The inside was nice and big. One waitress took care of our big party with ease and seemed very friendly. I ordered the fettuccine alfredo since I was craving pasta. My thing is, if a restaurant can serve you a simple entree and make it taste delicious, then that's all I need. Noodles weren't over-cooked, sauce had a rich, creamy consistency, and the chicken I added tasted tender. Ooh, I also tried some of the red velvet cake.. my cherry on top! No hangover the next day and was ready to strut down the strip for another nightly palooza!

I never leave here not full. They offer humongous portions and flavorful dishes. I like the sunday pasta, it has everything in it (beef stew with vegetables with sauce). I can come here for a solid meal breakfast, lunch and dinner.

This place was more between three and four stars. Everything we had was fine, but nothing was spectacular. 

Service
-They told us when we arrived that one person was taking our order and another would be taking care of us after, due to a shift change. The heads-up was good, but when the order came out wrong, the second server wasn't that helpful in fixing it. One of our friends ordered an egg white omelette and it came out made with eggs. He asked the waitress who said they could fix it, but it would take awhile. Shouldn't something they messed up be expedited?

Food
-We all got eggs or an omelette. The omelettes were pretty large and not greasy. My husband and I got ours made with veggies, and it definitely came with a lot of fresh veggies. The home fries they were served with looked like they were frozen and heated.
-Bread came in a basket for the whole table with butter and jam. It was toasted and pretty good. Nothing special, though.
-Not really their fault due to when we arrived for our meal, but wish they served breakfast for longer.

Drinks
-I just had water, but my husband and our friend each got a bloody mary. It was served with two pickled asparagus on top, which they both enjoyed a lot. They said they drink was a healthy amount of spicy!

Ambiance
-This is one of those places right off the casino floor. I get that many people come to Vegas for this, but it's actually not an aspect I enjoy due to all of the cigarette smoke. We were seated on the perimeter of the restaurant, so quite close to the casino. The restaurant is all open to the casino, but perhaps requesting a seat a bit further to the interior of the restaurant would block this smell a bit?

This was pretty quick and easy, but given the amount of options in Vegas, not sure I'd run back.
Quality of the food is great and the service is great. I love the all you can eat breakfast. I love that it's open late, but hate the fact that their not in the Boston area.
The best happy hour on the strip 4:00 - 6:30 pm M-F. Great selection of appetizers and cocktails for $5.50 each. Great food, service and location inside The Palazzo casino.

Go there quite often when playing poker at Venetian. The food is really good, there is a nice atmosphere, staff is nice, they have a huge selection and everyone seems to always enjoy their dishes. I wish they had more choices for vegans and one vegan dessert but there are a few menu options that can be tweaked for vegans, so it works . Bonus for late nighters... this location is open 24 hours :)
Reasonable price for Las Vegas and the service is decent. The food is pretty good too!

My first real dining experience in Las Vegas, and I loved it!  Our server was spectacular--perhaps THE BEST service I've ever received at a restaurant.

She suggested a fantastic appetizer, the fried mashed potato rolls, and they were terrific. Our pasta dinners were both excellent, and the cheesecake was really the best I've ever eaten. And I've had a lot of cheesecake!

A double shot of espresso and a relaxed atmosphere topped off this amazing night with my partner. I gladly give Grand Lux 5 stars!

Excellent for breakfasts, which is all I've had here. Tough to go wrong. If you order the short stack of pancakes, it's pretty large. They do a nice lox and bagel platter, too. Recommended, but it's somewhat pricey, but a good value. Warning: if you're meeting people, they refuse to take a list to help others in your eventual party find you. Beware you may have to sit outside the cafe and wait for them. Their management is nuts in this regard.

Had breakfast here because it was much cheaper than our hotel's shitty breakfast buffet. Got the best chicken and waffles ever! SO GOOD. It ranks as the top two chicken and waffles I've ever got!!! Husband got some taco egg thing that he liked it too.

This review is based on a terrible 20 minute end to an otherwise enjoyable time in the bar area of the Grand Lux Cafe. Two friends and I walked into the bar to have a couple of drinks before calling it a night (our first and only drinks of the night). One of us, who does not drink alcohol, ordered a coffee beverage (latte), his wife ordered a mojito and a shot of tequila, I decided to take a shot with her, so I ordered a shot of Belvedere and a pour of Balvenie 12 year as my sipper. The waiter brought out four drinks. The latte, my friend's mojito and two shots, one clear (vodka) which he gave to me and one brownish-gold (tequila) which he gave to my friend. I hate shots so I was waiting for my Balvenie to have something to sip after, but it was taking a while. Fortunately, I had a bottle of water I had brought in with me, so we went ahead with our shots (which were very generously poured, btw). After a few more minutes, I asked the waiter for a status on my Balvenie. He then told me he already brought it. I explained that he had brought my shot of Belvedere, but not my pour of the Balvenie. He didn't seem to believe us, but acknowledged and walked away, presumably to take care of it. A new waiter then came over and asked what happened, and we explained again. He seemed more accepting and intent on correcting the issue and proceeded to get my pour of Balvenie. With that in hand, we decided to order another round of shots. The tequila was way too strong for my friend, so she decided to take my advice and join me in another shot of Belvedere as I found it quite smooth. We drank our shots and the second one definitely tasted much harsher and was a noticeably more conservative pour than the first shot (if I were a more cynical person, I would question whether it was actually Belvedere) and continued talking, laughing and simply catching up with each other. Then the bill arrives:

They charged me for two Balvenie pours even though I only received the one I ordered. The difference between the Balvenie 12 and the Belvedere is only $1.50, but it wasn't correct and I did not feel responsible for having to pay for what I did not receive. I called the waiter over and explained that the bill was off and the situation (this is now the second one who came to help resolve the issue in the first place) and after explaining once again what had happened he acknowledged and stepped away. No big deal, people make mistakes. A few minutes later a gentleman that I presume is the manager, as I do not recall him introducing himself or being remotely cordial to us as customers at his restaurant, came over to talk about the confusion. I then proceeded to explain once again what happened. After a bit of what felt like cross examination, I and my friends explained the situation about three different times. Once again, the difference between a shot of Belvedere and a pour of Balvenie 12 is $1.50! One of the concerns this gentleman raised, which I found the most ridiculous was the notion that the first waiter was now gone and couldn't confirm what happened as if we were only now raising this issue and had not already addressed it with both the first waiter and the second waiter who was still present. Also, essentially implying that we were lying and without another, obviously honest, witness to validate our story, we should pay this bill. He then stepped away for quite some time, questioning the bartender, questioning others to get to the bottom of what he seemed to be treating as our conspiracy to pay $1.50 less on our $88 tab. I stepped away to use the restroom because he took so long to come back. When I got back, I was told by my friends that the presumed to be manager came back again and once again argued stating he spoke to the bartender and they confirmed that apparently the entire night they only poured two shots of Belvedere and two pours of Balvenie. Shortly after them taking me through this (our laughter, fun and good mood on our one night together in Vegas completely eliminated) the second waiter came back with the corrected bill, apologized sheepishly, and walked away. For the record, I do not blame the waiter. I'm sure he was probably trying to reverse and correct the charge, needed a supervisor or manager to approve this and then we got Sherlock on the case of my nefarious attempt to come to Vegas, spend an average of $90 on each of my personal meals, average of $20 on each cocktail at the Cosmo and Aria (which I adamantly recommend over this place) and $100 on a ticket to see The Who, only to cut costs and even out for the weekend by stealing a dollar and fifty cents from the Grand Lux Cafe. 

(BTW, I just noticed the tequila shot was $18. If we were going to lie about a drink to save money, why wouldn't we go for the $8 savings instead of the $1.50 savings? $8 would have almost covered the tip I still left for the waiter).

SImilar to cheesecake factory

+1 open late
+1 great food
+1 servers are tolerable of all the drunk people
+1 HUGE servings
+1 decent prices considering its a touristy area
My last review for the Grand Lux was in 2011. It's now 2015 and STILL this place did not disappoint. A little on the pricey side, but you really do get what you pay for.

So the food is very good for a chain restaurant. LOVE the asian nachos and potatoe rollers things. I want to try the Begniets and see how they stack up to New Orleans. I will say one thing that has miffed me there the last 3 visits is that I never get bread unless I ask. Are you saving the bread for something GLC?? I would give a 4 if it was not for the bread begging.

casual dining venetian hotel...family type restaurant....reservations recommended...group of nine for lunch...calamari $12.95 and chicken lettuce wrap $10.95 for appetizers...finding enormous mountain for deep fried calamari rings...decent bite to start....lettuce wrap fine and savory chicken heavily marinated\/seasoned...taking a combo of shaking beef and caramel chicken $20.50...intense saucing bit too salty and sweet...shaking beef bit too salty....caramel chicken a over sweetened orange chicken type of dish...battered, fried and generously sauced...portions are enormous!...share!...not a single person finishing their plate...enough variety and choices on the menu for anyone...definition of americanized over-sized meals overly sauced salty and sweet...roughly $55 per person gluttonous lunch...

After a long night at Tao, come here at 5am and order up a plate of pasta with sundried tomatos. It's gigantic, full of oil and starch to soak it all up. The sourdough bread on the table was deeelicious and a cup of coffee was a puurfect end to the night\/ morning.

oh god this place is heaven. i really like coming here because its open 24 7 and they have amazing food here. alot of people love the chicken and waffles but they also have amazing appetizers to choose from also and they  are all big portions and pretty bomb. last time i came here i had the chop steak with 3 different mushrooms including shitake as one of them kinds. it was amazing and tasteful and soo delicious for only 13 bucks with mash too.... i also had their vegam or vegeterian burger which wasnt too great i think the texture and the taste was kind of bland so dont recommend that. but most popular is chicken and waffles and their appetizers is what i hear people ordering around me. the drink prices in here are high so i would save it while im gambling i order there and tip the cocktail waitresses a dollar. 

service here is always on point and professional. the setting inside is casual and dark. and is inside the casino in a corner. the prices here are not that high but its definitely  worth the price  because of the huge portions they serve. and great presentation too.
Seated fast, tons of menu choices, friendly service and reasonably priced. I had Asian chicken salad - was yummy!  Chicken melted in my mouth!  Highly recommended.

Food is Okay. Breakfast wasn't very good (which is very disappointing when you are hung over) but their salads and sandwiches were decent. Can't really complain too much since it is open 24 hours but its not super special.
Go with a group of people and order a bunch of appetizers and desserts.....have a few drinks and have a great meal! BUFFALO EGGROLLS!!! And the bread pudding is amazing!

Best restaurant in Vegas, hands down! Open 24 hours...AWESOME! Service is top notch, food is delicious! Just to name a few of my faves...ASIAN NACHOS, CHICKEN ROYALE, POT ROAST! You won't regret going here trust me. We usually spend 5 days in Vegas and eat here at least 2-3 times.

We ate at the Grand Lux Cafe at The Venetian in Las Vegas and it was our first time.  The only thing that I heard about this place before we went was that it was a spinoff from the creators of The Cheesecake Factory.  I figured it would probably be good.

We went for breakfast one morning and took our two kids.  My wife opted for the 'Express Breakfast", aka the buffet.  They had all sorts of fresh fruit, pastries, yogurt, bacon, sausage and breads.  They also had cook to order omlets.  My wife enjoyed it all.  Pretty good for being a buffet.

I ordered the Chilaquiles off of the menu.  I couldn't have made a better choice!  Delicious ranchero sauce, cheese, scrambled eggs, tortilla strips and I'm sure other stuff. All I remember was that it was heaven.  My wife thinks I'm crazy because I kept talking about how good my breakfast was the entire day.  In fact it was so good that we went out of our way to go back the next day for breakfast.

Unfortunately I can't comment on other menu items but the menu was large and varied as others have already mentioned.  Also, the portions are big.

Great food, I'll be sure to stop by whenever we are somewhere that Grand Lux Cafe is.

I've eaten here countless times, whether it be for breakfast, dinner before a crazy night out, and for late late hangover cure meals. They also always seem to be open and busy regardless what time of the day it is. THat's always a good sign. And the service is quick which makes waiting for a table a quick process!

Yes, it's similar to the Cheesecake Factory with their menu diverse and offers almost everything. But not to worry, despite their vast menu, the quality of food has NEVER suffered! The portions are huge but I never take it with me simply because my hotel room lacks a fridge and microwave for reheating purposed. The salads are always on point, fresh & crisp and not doused in heavy dressings. The pastas are always rich and creamy, and the sandwiches and appetizers are delicious. They also have great lunch combos for a great price and the breakfast meals are dynamite. Again, the portions are huge, even if it's only lunch for for the great menu pricing and quality, its worth it!
Perfect restaurant. Good quality to a really fair price. I had salat, chicken. Every time you get warm bread. Delicious. Go there.

My go to restaurant whenever I'm in Vegas. This place is awesome and they have food at all hours of the night and even in your room with room service. 

I recently discovered their "to-go" shop tucked right next door to the restaurant. They have the best turkey Havarti sandwich that I like to get when I'm arriving late and am hungry. I always stay at the Venetian so it is very convenient. 

Their fruit cups there are also tasty when you feel like eating light and healthy to try to look good in that bikini for all you ladies. 

Great place to eat. Highly recommended
Ever eaten at Cheesecake Factory? Then you've eaten here. Only difference is you will pay more.

For this location, I met up with my cousins for a late-late lunch and ordered a salad and a root beer. The menu is huge so I opted for the Asian Chicken salad. It was pretty yummy, but the meal came out to be about $20+. I was able to eat half the salad at Grand Lux and half the salad at the airport.

Highly do NOT recommend. 

Service is slacking but probably because the kitchen is so slow. I'm sitting here still waiting for my meal as I type this review. 40 minutes and counting... Our appetizers came out about ten minutes ago. The clam chowder and Asian nachos are on the very salty side. The mac n cheese tasted like just boiled pasta. Where was the cheese??? I have no idea. It was my first time sending back a plate of food. The waitress ended up apologizing and saying that "that's just how the cooks here do it, they toss it in some Alfredo and sprinkle a little cheese on top. Sorry!!

Honestly, I was hoping this place would be much better but it really disappointed me. My friends and I were hungry at 3 am and the Grand Lux Cafe was open so we decided to eat here. 

We were seated within 5 minutes and then we waited a while for our waiter. Finally, we ordered, and I got the tomato soup expecting a nice simple red soup with maybe some basil. I was extremely disappointed when the tomato soup came out a while later with beans and onions and the flavor was spicy. The soup was chunky and nothing like a tomato soup I have had before. It was not good and cost me about 10 dollars of something I was only able to eat 1\/4 of. 

I wish I had ordered a sandwich with the salad because it looked much better than what I got. This place does have a huge menu and it's my fault for picking probably the worst thing on it. 

I would give this place another chance but the service was really slow, granted it was late, and I just wish my soup was better. Overall one of my least favorite meals I have had in a long time and it should have been much better.

Late Night Cookies n Coffee only

OK, so hankering for something of substance in the sweet department, we wandered over to Grand Lux Cafe. (There's one fairly close to my place, but I've never gone --- for what that's worth.)

They offer chocolate chip\/pecan cookies. In a box. Sounds good -- and they are. But, so ya know: Once we ordered them, the server told us it takes between 16 and 18 minutes. Verrrry specific. No problem. However, after not seeing them for, say, between 25 or 26 minutes later, I wondered what was going on...?

Meantime, my double espresso came, and that was just fine. 

At last, the box o' cookies came and they were ..... pretty good. But only luke-warm. Now, of course, these babies have to cool. However, it's apparent they were ready, and cooled, and they simply didn't get delivered in a timely fashion. (Sigh) Not a deal-breaker, but certainly a bit of a let-down.

They are served in a handsome cardboard. And it's fun to take the rest with you. Just next time, I'd really love them coming out HOT!

Love ! Love ! This place . It was recommended to me while I was looking for Dennys, glad I decided to give it a try . The breakfast buffet is great for $20. The Belgian waffles from here are my fav . Love the omelette station !! I also love there Bellinis and Mimosas. The staff is very diverse which I love seeing and everyone is friendly . 

Ask for Amanda !!! She's the best

So my Yelp account is basically a diary of the last 11 years of my life and if you were to look back into a wee little bratty 23 year old Maria D., she would not be caught dead admitting she ate here in a public forum. 

But old AF Maria D. doesn't care what you think and is here to tell you that Grand Lux Cafe is the jam. 

My man and I shared the ultimate chain restaurant food, the chicken quesadilla and it was everything you'd expect: filled with fat and sodium and delicious. I followed that up with chicken and waffles and it was legitimately good. Like, the kind of food you'd rave about if it were served at a hipster establishment you waited in line for. But the waffle was light and fluffy and the fried chicken was bomb. 

So. Grand Lux Cafe. I can hang wichu when I walk by you for the trillionth time next time I'm at the Venetian casino.

It was my first time here and everything is absolutely perfect ! Here is open 7\/24 and they serve perfectly altough it's 2:30 am ! I got fettucini alfredo w mushroom and i can say that these guys make it better than little itally. To be honest here is the one of the best place to eat in Las Vegas...

This place deserves 5 stars: 4 stars for the food and +1 stars for being open 24\/7.

Leaving the club at 3 AM and super hungry? This place has legitimately good food for a decent price.  Waking up at 6 AM to drive home and avoid the insane NYE traffic? Thank God for Grand Lux!

I tend to eat here every time I come to Vegas, which is saying something.  Usually it's in the wee hours of the morning but I'm happy to say that the service and food has never failed me.  For breakfast I really recommend the Joe's scramble (Palazzo Grand Lux) and red velvet pancakes.  The hubby really likes the protein breakfast.  My friend ordered the Shepard's pie for dinner and said it was really amazing.  This place is owned by Cheesecake Factory so everything is going to taste pretty good, you literally cannot go wrong!  

Tip: Only the Venetian Grand Lux is open 24\/7.  The one at the Palazzo is not, but has slightly different menu options.
Huge fan of this spot after TAO or LAVO!  Love their Garlic Shrimp Noodle or their Eggs, any style, Hash Brown Potatoes with Toast! =P  Used to come here twice a week.  Miss this place!

We went into this buffet with high expectations and we're very pleased! The price was not bad for how good the food and service was. We did not have to wait at all to be seated or served either. If you would like the opposite experience to the one we had here at the Grand Lux Cafe, then try the Buffet at the Wynn, although we do not advise it.

Everything that I have tried on the menu so far is really good. I'm definitely a big fan of their appetizers. The spinach and artichoke dip, edamame and calamari salad. 

Service is always great, and they always serve bread and butter. But I ask for jams with my bread. 

There are only two Grand Lux Cafe in town both in the Sands Properties, Venetian and Palazzo. The Palazzo location closes at 3 a.m. and the Venetian has the 24 hour one.

Best place to stop by if you're fiending for good food after clubbing at Tao or Lavo.

I went to the one at The Venetian and I must say I love this place and I would definitely come here again. It's just like the Cheesecake factory but service was way better. There was at least 25-30 of us with one waiter. He was able to accomodate everyone without any hesitation and we didn't even have to wait that long for our food to come. 

Their portions are HUGE. I had the chopped steak and I wasn't able to finish it. Actually I don't think anyone really finished their food=P
Nice atmosphere but I think the food is overpriced. It's a nice restaurant for a group though

Best food on The Strip. And the bartenders? Fabulous.

After a corporate dinner at Sushi Samba and drinking, er, a few, everyone started gambling in the casino and I wanted a burger. Grand Lux was the closest restaurant, and thank the food gods it was-they have the best. burgers. EVER.

At one in the morning I had the mushroom burger, and it was amazing. Came back 16 hours later and had the mushroom burger again (this time with a salad instead of fries-aren't you proud of me?) Came back again the next night for dinner and had the bacon cheddar burger. Outstanding. 

The fish tacos were also stellar, and my husband loved his avocado burger. Drinks were amazing too-I recommend the caramel apple and chocolate martinis. They are worth the splurge, trust me.

Menu is huge and would have loved to try their brunch, but couldn't make it a 4th time with our flight. 

When I come back to Vegas, guess where I'll go?

Walking around trying to find a "foodie" grade restaurant that wasn't going to break the bank, we stumbled across this cafe\/restaurant in the Venetian Hotel. 

The restaurant itself was HUGE and we were kind of skeptical at first, because we had long written off Vegas as a foodie tragedy, but this cafe pleasantly surprised us. According to the waitress the bread was organic and made on site, all the sauces and salad dressings were made there and even the service was five star! This was my third visit to Vegas and my husband's many and both of us had a smile leaving this restaurant after our meal. 

Price was right too. For once, I didn't leave  thinking I was taken a advantage of.

So your staying at the Venetian and your hekka tired from getting your freak on over at TAO all night. Are you with me?? It's like 4:30 am and they have a full menu!! Got it?? This is not your average Denny's no sir. We were a pretty large party of 11 plus 1 giant banana named Ben. *see pic* It being so late or early depending on how you look at it I guess. It is Vegas after all but that's not the point here. We had to wait awhile before being seated where there were maybe 3 other occupied tables in our section so I wouldnt say it was busy by any means. Our waitress her name escapes me. Sorry, late night!! But she was AWESOME!! Seriously 11 drunktards and she was hekka cheery chatting mith us, taking orders, making suggestions, playing with Ben ,etc. I cant remembered what everyone ordered but I don't think anyone was too impressed with the food, nothing stood out and a few people had to change their orders for they ran out of some things. I on the other hand always order my good ole Vegas stand by bagel & lox, well you cant really mess that up too much now can you?? So in summation basically if there is nothing else open, you dont feel like walking, and the elevator to your suite is right next to this place I would definitely go again!

Highly recommend the indochine chicken and shrimp. Was surprisingly good!

Favorite lunch item on here is the spicy flatbread chicken sandwich. Very tasty.

There are like 400 reviews for this place, just go, there's something for everyone here. For all you new yorkers, this is the cheesecake factory of Las Vegas, except for the cheesecake factory at Caesars :)

I usually stay at the Venetian and after a full day of traveling, the Grand Lux Cafe is the place to go. You'd figure with all the restaurants and snack kiosks around, why would someone visit the same restaurant twice? Well, first of all, it's the first restaurant you see walking out of your elevator... and also because they have great food at affordable prices.

They have three menus that rotate throughout the day. There's a morning (6 AM - 11 AM), a lunch (11 AM - 12 PM), and a late night (12 PM - 6 AM) menu. Each menu serves a variety of breakfast platters, sandwiches, burgers, and pasta dishes. There are two of the same restaurants somewhere in the area, so you have to check the hours cause I think one does close down for a few hours.

Oh one more word of advice, if you plan on eating there, call in and make a reservation, it gets pretty packed throughout the day!

I love the fact that this place is open 24\/7! There's another location at the Palazzo, but they're not open all day though. My bf and I were craving for some food at 3 in the morning, so we set out here to get some grub!

When we arrived, we were immediately seated and our server was very friendly. There is a late night dining menu, which has your salads, pasta, pizza, steaks, and also the breakfast menu! Score! 

We ordered:

1. Double Stuffed Potato Spring Rolls: This is a must-have appetizer! Creamy mashed potatoes with green onions wrapped in egg roll along with bacon, cheddar and a sour cream dip! Very savory and delicious. (5\/5) 

2. Fresh Garden Omelette: My order came with hash browns, white bread\/jam! The omelette consisted of mushrooms, heirloom tomatoes, avocado, zucchini, spinach, Havarti cheese and sour cream. The omelette was very filling; I wasn't a fan of the tomatoes but everything else tasted great. The hash browns were so good! (5\/5)

3. Rib Eye Steak: My bf loves his protein and meat. The steak was delicious and you get your choice of mashed potatoes or veggies. He opted for the mashed potatoes and OMG there were mountains of mashed potatoes on his plate! The potatoes were perfectly seasoned and flavorful, yum! (5\/5)

Overall, the portions here are big. Like what the other Yelpers say, this definitely reminds me of a Cheesecake Factory with an expansive menu and large portions! Definitely worth your money! =)

This is one of my go-to restaurants for visitors wanting to take me to lunch or dinner. The prices are very reasonable for ridiculously large portions. Darn, once again I forgot to take photos of the wonderful food we enjoyed last night. Almost any meal I've ever had here can be shared by two.

A nice warm crusty loaf of bread is brought to the table to start. For my entree I tried something new last night, Indochine Shrimp & Chicken ($19) & it was 5 star. The flavor was out of this world: onions, ginger, cranberries, sun-dried cherries in a plum wine cream curry sauce served with rice. I ate a lot but I didn't even get through half of it. My friend had Parmesan Chicken (under $20) & he agreed with what I told him I had thought in the past: best he's ever had. He also had more than half left-over. 

While eating we saw a monster strawberry shortcake dessert get carried past us & my friend had to try that-delicious. I had the waiter bring me an eclair from the bakery attached to the restaurant. Again, leftovers.

Though I gave GLC 5 stars, if 4 1\/2 were an option I'd have demoted it. Or if I have the same problem with the waitstaff again I'll give it 4 stars: The wait for the entree & then the dessert was very long. Our water glasses were never refreshed. I wasn't asked if I wanted white or brown rice with my dish. There's another reason I might demote GLC in the future: it's quite noisy & tables are crowded pretty closely together. Upon my insistence we were lucky enough to be seated at one of the only booths in the place.

I still highly recommend Grand Lux Cafe to locals & visitors wanting a reasonably priced  great meal & varied menu.

3.5 stars... really just for the fact it is 24hrs and it's nice inside. 

I had the Ruben sandwich. It was huge! And yummy. My boyfriend had the eggs, hash browns, with ham. They were just ok. Kinda bland and needed some salt and pepper. My sister had the chopped salad that was drenched in dressing... she forgot to ask to hold the bleu cheese... didn't like it too much. We also shared the calamari with shrimp. It was pretty good minus the fact it was a little too oily for me. 

Overall it's a nice place (it's a Cheesecake factory). Service was nice, but a little slow. We ordered simple food that seemed to take forever. Would be back again... only if staying in the hotel... otherwise would head over to the Cal for Hawaiian eats.

Not bad for a casino breakfast.  The honey vanilla latte was super tasty and sort of made up for my lackluster breakfast sandwich.  The service is quick, the prices are Vegas-reasonable, and it's convenient.  I've been here a few times and it's consistent in those things so I will probably find myself back here again.

I absolutely love this place. The staff is great very knowledgeable when it comes to suggesting food you will love. You can feel that they know what taste good. The wine pairings are exquisite. The manager is so accommodating  he makes you feel very special. His an awesome guy. When we ate there I heard that he was having a health issue but he made us feel like royalties.there was no way you can tell he was dealing with something ,I wish everyone is like that ,willing to do their work inspite  of anything. Your the best.i will definitely come to enjoy the food and hang out with you. 
Love your pastas and bread.
Its an elevated Dennys. Menu is huge. Always make my way here after drinking lots of booze. Good for the drunken stomach.

Looking for a great happy hour? This is the spot!! $5 bar menu from 4:30-6:30. The food is delicious. Sliders, Asian nachos (bomb) and buffalo chicken rolls were too much for my wife and I to finish. Clean, smoke free, right off the casino floor. You must check this place out. We'll be back soon.

The atmosphere was nice and impressive. I myself ordered the Chicken Meatloaf which was very tasty. My partner on the other hand had the Chicken Royale which was very unsatisfying. It had no flavor and to be honest the green beans and carrots that were the side dishes had lots more flavor and were more pleasing. 

My waiter was attentive once the food came out, but before hand he was out of sight. 

I probably will not be back.

Came here for 2nd year in a row while attending convention and the place is still packed and still a pretty good value. They have lunch specials that are very well priced and taste isn't too bad. Our server was very friendly and attentive.

Great food and staff. Had dinner there last night, could not ask for better service. Our server was magnificent, I even remember he's name "Marcos". Thank you for making it a great experience and I'll be there again next month. We will make sure we ask for you! Thank you!

My favorite casino restaurant in Las Vegas! 

The modern classy decor is beautiful. The dim lighting makes it classier.

It can be loud during the dinner hours though. The line can get long at night but it's not too much of a wait since it is big restaurant. 

A few of my favorites are the Santa Barbara Chicken Sandwich, Southwestern Salad, and the Asian Chicken Salad.

There is a pastry counter outside the restaurant as well.

If I could only give this place 0 stars, I would.
Long story short, you better hope you don't get the redhead, Sierra, as your waitress. And the manager on duty was just as terrible, if not worse. Let me tell you why. 

Now don't get me wrong, my boyfriend and I have ALWAYS loved dining here in the past. But this time around, I don't know what it was that changed but we certainly left HATING the place.

We came in on a Wednesday night. 
My boyfriend and I were seated and we found our initial server to be quite awkward and seemingly uninterested in obtaining our orders. After about 20 minutes of waiting he finally comes around and tells us they were undergoing a shift change and asked if our new server had been around yet. Nope. Nothing yet. But that's fine, should be understandable given the shift change, right? He then takes our orders before he leaves.

So our initial server leaves and we literally waited another 30 minutes before our food came out, and it wasn't until 10 minutes after that some lady decides to finally come and ask how everything is tasting. I'm sorry... but who are you? Oh that's right... you must be our server? 

At the table across from me I observe a lady and her husband getting just as irritated with the lack of service from our same waitress and elapsed time waiting on their food.

Fast forward all of the ridiculous waiting and our almost non-existent server, she finally comes around to give us the bill. I had never been so irritated with such service or the lack of in my entire life, and I am usually the patient one between my boyfriend and I (might I add, we also used to be servers too).

Silly me, I decide to take it up to the manager as we are leaving... And he could not be any less disinterested! Sierra comes along to see what's going on (because I'm SURE she knows what crappy service she delivered) and as I begin to complain she just gives me that "I don't have time for this" look and is dismissed by her unapologetic manager. 

He showed no remorse, whatsoever. All I did was complain about the lack of service and a simple apology would have sufficed. My boyfriend and I have BOTH been servers in the past. I don't care if you're having a bad day, you're just slow as heck, or running behind... You still say SORRY.

Now I don't know if the manager just didn't take me seriously since I didn't wear my "big girl" pants and heels that night (maybe he thinks I'm just some child trying to get comped for a meal, who knows??). But as a current nurse and past waitress I would like to see how he would feel if he were my patient\/customer complaining about his issues and I just stared at him blankly with no remorse or reaction.

But anyway... vent session, over lol. Hopefully everyone's experience will be MUCH better than ours :)

Note: this is cheesecake factory's sister chain.
This was a good place for lunch and late night\/ early morning drunk food. Our group came here for both occasions and the food was equally as good as the other. Not only were there tons of things to choose from but they all were really appetizing. The prices were decent and it's something different from the fast food court. We came to this specific location for lunch one day and we all got different things. I ordered the half salad and pasta de telefono. The salad was a spring mix and was good, and the pasta was very cheesy but since I enjoy cheese it was delicious. The addition of chicken was a rip off but I needed some poultry with my pasta so I couldn't complain too much. Others had pastas, salmon and sandwiches which I heard were all good as well.

One of my favorite restaurants and this location in Vegas on the strip didn't disappoint. We brought friends with us who had never heard of the Grand Lux. They were extremely pleased and new fans. The red velvet pancakes and amazingly delicious, words can't describe how much I love them.

The food is super-rich.  You will get very full if you attempt to eat everything on your plate.  I have ordered pasta and steak and both were excellent.  I would say the pasta dishes are the way to go, as the few sauces I've ordered were very good.  I got a bite of my wife's iceberg salad and it was very good as well.  They serve Cheesecake Factory dessert, so try to save enough room.

When we're in Vegas, we stay in the Venetian 90% of the time.  Having the restaurant right near our elevator is a plus, just a short walk and you'll get some great food.  My wife and I already enjoy The Cheesecake Factor, so with this being a sister company, I was sure we'd love it (and we did).

During our last visit a few months ago, where we stayed for 4 days, we at there at least once a day.  We ordered pizza, steak, italian, burgers and always had a very enjoyable meal.  The staff has always been helpful and friendly and we'll be going back again and again during each future visit!

Minus one star for the service. Overall, great food. I ordered the Asian chicken salad. It was tasty and full of flavor. The chicken was a bit dry though. The service on the other hand was not the best. When my friend and I were seated, there was another group who came in 5 minutes after us. They were served first which which was wrong. My friend and I were sitting there for 15-20 minutes, nobody served us.
Very good, big portions, healthy options, huge menu with basically something for everyone!  Definitely will come back!
Great service! Food was pretty good, I didn't think there was any wow factor. The margs are delicious too!

The service was great at 3:30 in the morning. If you enjoy Cheese cake factory then this is its half sister. The setting,  the floors, the bread, and everything is almost the same. The would was delicious. No complaints. The sandwich was ok and the side salad with the home made vinaigrette was excellent. I had the turkey bacon sandwich. I didn't finish it all and kept half to go. The French fries was good.

Absolutely terrible.  The menu items seemed like foodie choices, so I expected good food.  Our waitress was slow and entirely too nonchalant, but she at least wasn't rude.  However, the food was awful.  I had the goat cheese salad.  Waaaay too sweet and the fried goat cheese balls were soggy.  I had the duck wontons, they were the best thing on the menu.  My entree was disgusting.  BBQ salmon DROWNED in BBQ sauce.  Like I had to scrape it off just to find the salmon.  While the salmon was cooked perfectly, the sauce ruined it.  I had it with brussel sprouts.  They were very burnt and also cold.  I don't remember my other side, but I know I left hungry!  I ordered a Moscow Mule and it was waay too sweet and weak.  I strongly advise against trying this place out.

I would have complained to management, but my waitress was so slow I didn't have time.

breakfast until 11am! 

the lighting is so great and sexy that you never know what time it is. fits right in with the venetian mood lighting. 

best breakfast any where in vegas.

service is awesome too

Prompt attentive service. Wife had seafood salad, 3.5 stars, I had the Indochine shrimp and chicken, awesome, 5 stars. Elegant decor. A but noisy the closer you sit to the kitchen. Solid 3.5- 4 stars.

phone yelp.

3 stars because I'm averaging  experiences.  the first 2 were 4 star worthy - good food, cheap prices for vegas standards, and and decent service - but the last experience was terrible.  

for late night delights, u want a place that fulfills the two fs - filling and friendly.  because the service was terribly slow - it took over an hour to get food at 5 am when no one was there - and by that time nothing could satisfy our hunger -  this place only gets one F.

Love this place!  We visit Las Vegas twice a year and always include a visit to the Grand Lux. Have never had anything but an excellent meal.  I now must eat gluten-free and they accommodate me very well.

The Cheesecake Factory's little sister.

Same gigantic sized portions as the old sister.

It's an alright place if you have just arrived to LV and you're so hungry that you're having black-outs on and off, and you don't have the urge to search anything else. 

Don't spend too much money on there, just get something quick, like a salad (size-wise was huge!), the mojitos were bad; sugar loaded no twisted flavor, what kind of mojitos are these? Got confused a bit. I got mexican paloma with Southwestern chicken salad, the lunch size, this got me confused too, cos the lunch size was pretty big, I didn't wanna imagine the dinner size.... Do they think that humans are cows and have three stomachs? 

Anyway, this is your first and last resort. You definitely can find better place to eat, but if you're too lazy it's just there!

No photos, sorry,  I was so hungry that I didn't care.

4 stars for our waiter, beignets, and the warm butter cake.  The beignets were served with 3 sauces..chocolate, strawberry, and Jack Daniels.  Sauces were
good but the beignets stole the show.  They were light and puffy, delicious.

Now on to my favorite dessert right now, warm butter cake.  It's outstanding here.  Light, buttery, and just the right amount of crisp around the outer circle.  This is served with ice cream, strawberries, and whipped cream.  Absolutely a must eat!

Why they didn't call this place Cheesecake Factory baffles me, because it is the same thing! The menu is massive, the portions were some of the biggest I've seen in Vegas (outside of a buffet) and it's the same selection of cheesecake.

But for me - that wasn't a problem, because I've never had any complaints about Cheesecake Factory. Our cab driver who took us to Mystere across the street at Treasure Island suggested we try this place. I'm glad he did because it was one of the most satisfying meals we had while we were partying. I ordered a spinach dip appetizer for the table and the chopped salad for my entree (which I couldn't finish it was so big!)

Service was prompt and attentive. It was a great base for our last night out in Vegas.
Every time I come to Vegas I eat here like twice a day. The southwest salad is so good and the slice of cheesecake is bigger than my foot. Mmmmz
I love this place. It's 24 hours with great food and good service. I love the seared ahi appetizer and the volcano shrimp

I feel a little unfair giving them only three stars since I've only been here once and it could have been an isolated incident but 3 stars is still "A-OK"

We stayed in the Venetian and the Grand Lux is as convenient as it comes for Venetian guests. Right below the rooms, around the corner from the guest elevators and open all night.

When we went, it was 3:30am, we were all buzzing, tired and STARVING. We were sat rather quickly, despite the line, served water and menues, had our orders taken, then left alone... For forever. 

After about twenty minutes, a waitress swooped by and dropped some bread on the table. We get bread?? About forty-five minutes after that, we're all falling asleep on our table and our waiter comes by to apologize for the wait. He said everybody ordered breakfast all at once and the cooks are overwhelmed. Understandable enough... Until we looked around and no one in the restaurant is eating. If they're cooking, shouldn't SOMEONE be eating?

Fast forward another half hour and we decide to cancel our order with the waiter and go upstairs, right then, of course, our food shows up. 

Now, there are 260+ reviews that will tell you the same thing, but just to be another to say it, the food was delicious!! Of course it was delicious! I was a little sad that I couldn't finish it all. I got the Chicken Flautas, they were crispy on the outside, creamy on the inside and the avocado sauce was just spicy enough. It's apparently one of the more popular late-night orders, along with the Buffalo Eggrolls, which I was told were also kind of perfect. My friend that ordered the Egg White Omelette said it was THE BEST omelette he's ever had. That's as good as it gets, literally! So I don't know, is the amazing food worth an hour and a half wait in the middle of the night? Your choice. Be drunk enough to not care or not hungry enough to notice.

Cheesecake factory-like restaurant.  I wouldn't say they have the best food, but it's good for what you pay for.  I would really give this more of a 3.5 star.  

First time I was here, I wanted some comfort food that reminded me of home since we didn't check into the hotel till 2am!  I ordered their Zen Chicken Noodle Soup ( americanized version of pho).  Let me say, not good! The dish was presented nicely, with the soup coming out separately in a saucer, but I was very disappointed with the taste of it.  The chicken were all sliced chicken breast.  Ugh, I should've known better not the order noodle soup here.  I mean, some of their other Asian dishes are good, so I wanted to give it a try.  Nope, wrong! 

However, the server recommended the crispy shrimp and chicken rolls, which tasted excellent!  It was hot and crispy, and had a side of a tangy sauce.  

Recently came here again and we ordered he rolls again, along with an order of their oversized burger and 2 pastas.  Dinner was delish and cheap! Left as a happy camper and would most likely come back again if I was staying at the hotel.

If you have a craving for pho then I highly recommend that you try their Zen noodles. It was fantastic! They make sure you get plenty of lemongrass soup broth, which wasn't salty at all. Definitely cheaper than getting pho at Zine!

I prefer the Palazzo location over the Venetian location.  My favorite is the French Toast during brunch.  It is crispy on the outside and soft, warm, and gooey on the inside.  I have never experienced French Toast like this, but I am hooked and have been since trying it a couple of years ago.  I always order it with a mimosa, freshly sliced strawberries and bananas, and it includes the caramel syrup. OMG!!!  

Yum!

Amazing! We had the breakfast buffet. There isn't a huge selection of food but what they have out taste terrific. We did some quick math and it would've been twice as expensive to order those things individually. The wife moved the fresh squeezed orange juice. And for me free refills on the milk was a great bonus.

This afternoon on a staycation with family, we ate in the Grand Lux Cafe.With a location in the Venetian, I felt like I was transplanted to a cafe in Venice.

  Grand Lux Cafe is the upscale brand of the Cheesecake Factory. The restaurants are upscale with decent prices. They include a bar and bakery.

 The Cheesecake Factory website states that the Grand Lux Cafe came into existence when the Venetian asked David Overton, who was the founder of Cheesecake Factory to design an upscale restaurant for his resort. The story goes that he went all over Europe doing culinary research. The research resulted in the very first Grand Lux Cafe-where we had lunch this afternoon. 

  Our experience was that Grand Lux Cafe is upscale and affordable. Our table overlooked the extravagant Venetian. 

 In my opinion, where the menu shines is the lunch special. It is from 11 to 5. The lunch specials include Lunch soup\/ salad ($10.95), Rustic pizza & salad ($11.95), Lunch salad ($9.95-11.95), Lunch enchiladas ($11.95), Lunch pasta & salad ($10.95-$11.15), and Lunch salmon ($13.25).

  I was going to order the Lunch pasta & salad. When I asked the Waitress if the lunch portion is enough to fill you up, she answered that depends on your appetite. With that nebulous answer, I ordered the BLT with french fries. I don't think this was the kind of dish that David Overton was researching in Europe. Overall I was happy with the food.

  I enjoyed having lunch in Grand Lux Cafe. I was off from work and with family. It is not too often that I get to have lunch in Venice. It was a change of scenery with good food that I appreciated. I am showing this appreciation with a 4 star rating.

The Yelp 100 Challenge. Review 50.

This is usually a good restaurant that I visit at least once every 2 trips to Vegas. Not this time. This trip we took with 4 other friends and have went here 3 times.  The last 2 are the reason for this review. We ate breakfast yesterday, I ordered a simple egg white scramble with fruit. I had to send the eggs back 2 times, once because they weren't only whites and the 2nd because they had so much oil on them they looked wet from across the table. It made my stomach upset, even the new batch had oil after I requested none. Second trip was last night, we wanted a midnight snack and after ordering the loaded potato rolls 3 days ago we ordered them again,  no bacon this time plus hummus and a personal margherita pizza for the hubby. The pizza was good he said, but the potato rolls were awful. They came just as I ordered but add you can see, there are barely any potatoes in the STUFFED rolls. We basically had fried wonton wrappers :\/ . I won't go on and on, I'll just say we won't be going back again unless it's for the Belgian waffle, but you can get those almost anywhere, I prefer healthy eggs.

If you're looking for a great value, scrumptious tasting food in a casual atmosphere, and a warm & friendly staff then this is the place to try. Open 24\/7, They have lunch specials & weekend brunch along w\/ a unique blend of bistro\/cafe\/pastry shoppe inspired dishes. Think of it as a fusion of around-the-world flavors.
Nice non-buffet breakfast. Feels like a fancy cheese cake factory. Generous servings.

Note: This review is based on some very hazy memories of incidents that occurred at around 2:00 AM.

It was a bit pricey, sure, but the silverware was quite professionally bound in a white linen napkin. Mmm. Linen. I also remember the clear glass plates. How awesome is that? Who uses glass plates these days...apparently only the cool kids at the G-Lux. 

I had one of Hannah W.'s fries. It was utterly perfect, dipped in cold red ketchup. Expect nothing but the freshest, purest ingredients when you first taste the banana creme pie, as well as the two flavors of creme brulee.

It was really dark in there, for some reason. It made me sleepy. But we had also arrived just in time to beat the clubbing crowds who were hunting for a last-minute snack. I love it when that happens.

Food is always delicious here. The wait can be very long so it's best to plan ahead.

Apps
1) potato rolls
2) buffalo rolls

Main entree
1) chicken parm
2) ribeye steak

Drinks
1) island cooler
2) mango smoothie

The food was greater than I expected! I had the chicken tortilla soup and tried my boyfriend's clam chowder. Both so delish! There was no wait when we went in around noonish. I ordered the Sunday Night Pasta and it was good! We definitely didn't expect to get full so fast, so we had to box 2\/3 of our entrees home. This place is in the Venetian. I never wanted to try this place just because the one in LA had really bad ratings, but for sure I really only go to the Grand Lux Cafe in LV.

Huge menu and a great place after a late night out. Pizza was a decent size to share for 2-3 people as a snack and was plentiful in veggies. Crust was thin and crisp.
House Green Salad, Organic Greens and Heirloom Cherry Tomatoes Tossed in Our Roasted Tomato-Caramelized Onion Vinaigrette
Fire Roasted Vegetable, Grilled Eggplant, Zucchini, Artichokes, Peppers, Onions, Tomatoes, Basil, Goat and Mozzarella Cheeses. Kalamata Olives

i LOVE this place! 
Try anything on the menu...it's similar to Cheesecake Factory.

i usually go after dancing at Tao cuz it's open 24 hours. 
I wish the one in LA had the same hours of operation.

Their strawberry shortcake is to-die-for!! Once we got free dessert because our server dropped a plate of food near our table. It wasn't even our order but they felt bad about it happening near us so they gave us dessert. Great service huh. :)

Joe's Scramble is an excellent  breakfast dish worth the walk from another hotel.   Tasty combo of scrambled eggs, spinach, mushroom, seasoned ground beef, and onion accompanied by a side of homemade hash browns.   The portion is large enough to split, and be sure to ask for some of the house salsa.

Do I love staying at the Venetian? Yes.
Do I like Cheesecake Factory, Luxe's owners? Yes.
Could it be that I'm biased in favor of Luxe?  Yes.

Pros
This is definitely a nice place to eat with good food and nice ambiance.  Prices are ok.

Cons
Wait can be long.

Should you try this place out if you're in vegas?  Yes, but go during off hours to have the best experience.

It's next to the escalators and the slot machines near the bathrooms.
