Even through the drunken antics of the guys, he was gracious and continued to serve our party extremely well.

Word of advice: Skip the "breakfast buffet" Totally not worth the $16-something price on it. Not enough selections and the quality was mediocre at best. I was really disappointed with it. Just order from the regular breakfast menu.

*** Celiac Friendly ***
There are 2 of these; one in the Palazzo and one in the Venetian. I was in the Venetian. There is one downside and that is that it's built like a street side cafe which means that you should ask to sit in the back, as the "outside" part is right on the casino floor thick with choking cigarette and cigar smoke.

Now for the food. We were there for breakfast and I ordered the house-made corned beef hash (CBH). Breakfast for 2 arrived - and that was just mine! Along with the CBH were hash browns (superfluous since the CBH was 25% hash browns already) and a large amount of fresh fruit. And the taste? YUM!!! I will be back!

Potato spring rolls, Asian Chicken salad, Burban chicken, Pasta Telefono, Turkey and Brie sandwich, Veggie Burger, Shrimp Pasta, Buffalo Chicken sandwich, Crab cake appetizer--Everything we have ever ordered here is seriously delicious. The most appealing aspect of this restaurant is their consistency and open 24\/7. (Except every other Monday from 12am-6am, when they do their cleaning! --Found out the hard way) We recommend it to everyone who comes into town! My only suggestion would be more friendly hosts at the front desk.

Waffles, waffles, waffles!!  Only get the waffles.  Any kind.  Strawberry, blueberry or with chicken.  It was always good.  Made fresh with a malty crispy edge.  Served with butter and warm syrup and it doesn't get any better.  Don't order the coffee since it was just average for $3.95.  Get your coffee at Starbucks instead.

Wide variety of food to choose from. I was very bummed they took out the Sear Ahi Salad. Was the only thing I ordered when eating at Grand lux. Came with a party of 12+ we ordered a a bit of everything to pasta and rice entrees. The Asian influenced rice dished were a bit sweet ...from the curry and the So called orange chicken. I guess we couldn't expect more Asian flavors from an American franchise, but we wanted to try it and we had older relatives who were not use to the Western type of food.

The Asian nachos were interesting...was hoping for a great flavor profile from what i read...but it was overly too sweet from the drenched peanut mix sauce they used.  

The service was great and friendly... constant refills and checkups.  

Overall food was a miss this time, but will come back but gonna steer away from the Asian fusion\/influenced foods.

This is a great place to get good, average food, that's still a little lofty in price (hey it's vegas right?). 

It's a cheesecake factory baby that feels a bit like an upscale diner to me more than the factory itself. 

We typically get breakfast here as i'm not going to pass up the awesome restaurants to get diner food when i'm on vacation.

The menu is gigantic- which i hate.
Good lunch buffet, breakfast buffet was so so. We went during the transition time. The lunch buffet had tasty seafood, steak,chicken, egg Benedict,  and salads were superb.

Two Words: Food poisoning.
To make matters worse, I encountered another couple a couple days later who also fell to food poisoning from this place.

My husband had a custom made quesadilla with chicken at 3 am. But 5 am he was sooo sick. We ruled out a hangover when the stomach cramps and other ever-so-lovely food poising symptoms kicked in. Normally I say by-gones-be-by-gones but after hearing this other couple suffer from the same location, there is sufficient evidence that this restaurant needs to review their food prep policies. 

We have reported this to the manager hoping for a refund. We are in contact with corporate but I will be taking this to the state.

$100 got 2 people a great bottle of wine, a delicious meal (with very fresh ahi tuna), friendly & attentive service, and a nice setting.  It's surprisingly nice for being just off of the gaming floor, and the food delivers.

Best BLT I've ever had a restaurant. I realize that's an interesting observation about a place that can serve SO much more. But hey, if they can do the "simple" things well, that means the other stuff must be pretty good too!

The food is fabulous! I had the vegetarian tofu and its great.

I only wish the guy cleaning the tables near me had a little finesse. Wow, was he noisy!

I go to Grand Lux over any other places both in LV or Chicago. 

Give them a try!
Must visit while in Las vegas!  Foods proportions are ginormous! And the price is great.  Only 4* because the food is kind of bland.

MY NEW ABSOLUTE FAVORITE CHICKEN WINGS. In all certainty.

Slightly crispy, piping hot, yet with a spicy\/sour\/sweet\/sticky sauce over the top that is absolutely great.

Also tried the chicken sandwich and BBQ bacon burger -- everything was delicious.

Favorite late night food spot in Vegas fo shoooo!

I had lunch here on the last day of my vegas trip.
The prices great. menu very similar to cheesecake factory.
Very delicious food and great decor.
Perfectly place to grab a quick lunch on the go.

I love this place, Venetian is our home away from home and we eat at the Grand Lux Cafe every time we come, can not say enough about it, we tried so many things on different occasion and it always very good and always plenty on the plates..  Prefer the Venetian's to the Palazzo's..
Yummy food and great service...

Good for DRUNK MUNCHIES after TAO Nightclub.
Good for DINNER before all the club ratchet activities.
Good for LUNCH too.
I have not yet to try here for breakfast yet. It is quite hard to wake up early in Vegas.

I have one check in here but it's only because I just started to use Yelp. 

I have been going here EVERY SINGLE time I go to Vegas. I usually go to Vegas almost every month. My regular order is Pasta Telephono. It is basically pasta with marinara with bread crumbs on top. If you want chicken, its extra! This pasta reminds me one of the Corner Bakery's pasta with breadcrumbs. (I can't recall the name). 

I have also tried the Baby Back Ribs. Their portions are HUGE. So if you go with one person and have small appetite.... I say order one plate and share and get an appetizer. 

I have also tried their Eggroll on their Appetizer Menu. The sauce to dip that came along was so tangy! Loved it. Pasta Pomodoro is also something to try!

5-star. Excellent service. Excellent Food. I love the decorations.
OH, one thing I do not like is their lighting, it is so dark in there and makes me sleepy. BUT their food makes up for it.

I have to say I'm pretty disappointed by the service. Got seated right away, but it took 20 minutes for a server to come to us. I actually had to ask another server for water and ask for the manager before even being contacted. Manager barley apologized. Horrible service. Decent food.

Yes, Grand Lux is a chain, but with food and libations like this, who cares?!?  

We started with cocktails.  The Carmel Apple Martini is KILLER.  Now that they no longer offer their White Cosmo, this one is my favorite.  Two of my dining companions had Bloody Marys that were made just right -- spicy but not too.  One had a frozen Margarita that was well made and not overly sweet.

We stuck with appetizers on this trip, and the best of all were the crab cakes.  No doubt the best I've had with lumps of crab in a well seasoned mixture lightly grilled.  

We ordered the appetizer combo and enjoyed the following:

Vietnames Spring Rolls with chicken and fresh cut veggies in a steamed, cold wrap served with peanut sauce or spicy sweet and sour sauce.  Philli Cheese Steak spring rolls with diced steak and cheese in an eggroll wrappper fried and served with chipotle mayonaise.  Also eggroll style was the buffalo chicken served with the absolute best bleu cheese dressing I've ever had.  My husband's favorite were the steamed duck dumplings.  The Spinach Artichoke dip was creamy with plenty of artichoke. 

For dessert I had to revert to my all time favorite creme brulee duo - one vanilla and one chocolate.  Best ever!

It was 11:30 on a weekday.  Seating was immediate and service was outstanding.

Just finish ribs and a glass of the house red, cab.  Not bad for a meal late at night after just checking in. Price is reasonable, but not dirt cheap if that is what you are looking for.  The ribs were tender and fell off the bone.  But it's like a cheesecake factory, all is good, it'll be difficult to order something that doesn't taste good and not too expensive.  Certainly not ans dining experience restricted to vegas but I'm here on business.

this is so bizarre. saltiest meal ive ever had. it damaged my mouth and taste buds for basically 2 days. 

fries and a sandwich is all i had. couldn't tell you what type of sandwich but ive never been to a restaurant that has caused me physical harm. 

300 reviews and 4 stars for this place? its like im in the twilight zone. i do remember the menu being super big so maybe i ordered wrong things? 

silly me ordering french fries as a late night meal.

Went here all the time when I was a kid. Came here last during december 2013. Loved the shaking beef, so sad to see they dont serve it anymore. But the waitress recommended the spicy ginger beef which uses even more tender beef supposedly. It tasted almost the same just a little bit more spicy and gingery. I think if I ordered it without the spice and ginger it wouldve tasted nearly the same with just the sauce and green onions. But the spicy ginger beef was just WOW. i didnt expect it to be that good!

I ate here with some friends right before taking off for the airport.  The portion sizes were huge for the price.  The service was a little too slow for us, then again we were in a hurry to make our flight.

Almost exactly like the cheesecake factory (sister co) except in Vegas on the strip. We ate here twice the last time we stayed at the Venetian. The food choices are excellent no matter when you go and they are open 24 hours, so perfect for that hangover cure.
Have eaten here several times. Great food and service. Whether breakfast or dinner, it has never disappointed. Highly recommend.

This has to be one of the best breakfasts in Vegas!

In fact the whole menu is really good. Great value for money and great atmosphere! I came here after having so many POOR experiences in Vegas it was a refreshing change to actually like somewhere. The waiting staff are very quick and it has a great range of food.

Will be back every trip to Vegas!

I went here for lunch yesterday with a friend. I had never been in the Palazzo before, nor had I ever eaten at Grand Lux Cafe, so I was super excited to experience both. The cafe is easy to find coming off of the parking garage elevators, it's a quick jaunt across the casino floor. We were sat right away by a pleasant hostess and received a booth as requested. The decor is beautiful in this cafe and the ceiling is simply stunning. It is a work of art, very beautiful.

Here's some pros & cons during my visit:

PRO's
1.) Large food selection
2.) Delicious, complimentary bread basket
3.) Great wait staff - courteous, helpful and kind
4.) Fantastic pot roast French fry appetizer (I recommend), yummy Manhattan salad and penne with a silky, smooth alfredo sauce
5.) Huge portions, easy to share

CONS's
1.) Food brought out wrong the first time and had to wait while they remade it
2.) Very pricey - think upscale, Cheesecake Factory
3.) Large food selection - I spent 20 minutes flipping through this huge menu trying to decide on something to eat
4.) The server we got was not knowledgeable on the menu. I asked simple questions like "what pasta does this dish come with?" and he didn't know.

All-in-all, I would definitely visit again for lunch, however I don't see myself coming for dinner service. I can see how this is a great spot for tourists or hotel guests though. Make sure you have more than a 1 hour lunch before eating here. It does take a bit of time.

I've been here several times and all the food is amazing.  Some of my favorites are the Brioche French toast, Eggs benedict, Crab & asparagus omelette, egg white omelette, or Joe's special for breakfast or brunch.  You can't have breakfast or brunch without one of their mimosa's or spicy bloody mary's...  YUM!  I also like the lemon chicken picata or miso glazed salmon for dinner.  For dessert they have delicious HOT chocolate chip cookies.  They are made fresh to order.  I'm sure whatever you order is going to be wonderful.  I have never been disappointed.

My friends and I went into Grand Lux Cafe at the Venetian for a late dinner and drinks.  The food was OK, our server was reasonably pleasant, but the night manager Matt Timms, when questioned about the cost of an item on our bill, was so off the charts rude- my friends and I will never come back!  Mr. Timms even went so far as to threaten to call my girlfriend's employer to make her look bad when he learned we were locals.  I've never seen someone lose their cool like that, especially not a manager.  There are many better options for restaurants within this casino.  Beware!

Grand Lux is the higher end scale of Cheesecake Factory.  Their menus are quiet similar yet very different.  I love all their food especially the chicken flautas and strawberry lemonade topped with creme brulee' dessert.  The only downfall is that it's inside The Venetian resort and I'm not a fan of the strip on my days off. XD

Late night goodness. 

So the Grand Lux is open 24 hours but I only ever find myself here when it's past midnight. On this night, one of the people in my group was complaining how hungry he was. I instantly recommended grand lux because I knew that it had a million items on the menu. 

My favorite item is the potato egg roll which is basically mashed potatoes with bacon wrapped and fried and served with sour cream. Yum! One of our group got calamari which was surprisingly melt in your mouth at 3 am. 

The menu is very extensive and there is something for everyone including alcohol and even gluten free options. 

The location is convenient in the Venetian and the prices run around $5-$20 depending on what dish you order.

Maybe I was hungry but I liked the food we had here.  When we got there they were going to seat us inside the main dining hall but I asked if we could sit in their patio area and they cleared out a table and sat us there.  It was Saturday night and the people watching (primarily girls in tight, tight, saran wrap dresses pulling down their dress every 5th step) was fun. We shared a mixed deep fried calamari, shrimp, onion plate which was quite large and very good.  I had a chicken sandwich with avocado, bacon, and cheese which was one of the better chicken sandwiches I've had.  Plus the fries were crisp, salty enough and just plain great.  The waitress was pleasant and took a dish off our bill when we realized we had over-ordered.  Very nice of her.  I just thought this place was really good and would go back for a simple bite any day.

If you want to enjoy a awesome b fast and listen to Phantom of the Opera tunes, this is the place to visit. Sit out front on the patio if you can and people watch.

My B fast order - corn beef with eggs and sliced tomatoes with English muffin. This is one of my faves for corn beef due to the corn beef is in chunks and is awesome tasting. The chef puts bell pepper's and a small amount of potatoes.  Yes it's pricey at $13.95 but it's all about the quality here. 

My friendly waitress from Chicago Amanda was awesome and has worked here since  they opened - 13 years ago now. The Grand Lux is owned by the Cheesecake Factory and the menu reflects their similarities.

Grand Lux has always been my go-to spot whenever I'm around the vicinity. Whether I'm staying at Venetian, or even a little bit further out like at TI or Encore, I always make that extra walk to eat here.

I really enjoy dining here for a quick meal. It's opened late, they have a big variety of different foods, and the service is always on point. The restaurant is quite big inside though it doesn't look that way outside of the front. It's great bc I never had to wait for a ta

I think I come here at least one or two lunches when I want to eat something decently good. Their salads and sandwiches are perfect for lunch. Also, I always find myself here when I'm hungry at odd hour like 10-11pm at night.

I really enjoy eating at Grand Lux. I honestly think you can't go wrong with dining here. They have something for EVERYONE. Their menu is quite extensive so even the pickiest eater can find something they like at Grand Lux. I highly recommend their sandwiches for lunch and pastas or big plates like their meatloaf for dinner or even 4th meal. Lol. You can't go wrong dining here at Grand Lux!!

What a way to start the day! Grand Lux looks and feels like a Cheesecake Factory inside a casino resort. Definitely not somewhere the average person could dine out on the regular, unless you are burning an exorbitant amount of calories every day.

Yes there are healthy options but when in Rome...

I enjoyed a breakfast sandwich served on a buttery croissant. Whether they make the pastries in house or not, it was glorious bread! 

Also part of the order included a yogurt bowl and short stack of pancakes. Not a typical Wednesday ordeal but tasty nonetheless.

Seriously delish! The waiters are super friendly and fast. The food was yummy and fresh and it's owned by the same people that own The Cheesecake Factory so you know the menu is huge!  The cheeseburger I had was cooked to perfection and the fries were killer. We ordered several drinks for the table and I can say without a doubt that their alcoholic mixed drinks are all delicious but the Limoncello Lemonade is sooo good! It was a nice ambiance overall and the perfect setting for my best friend's 31st birthday party.

The only con that I had was that the cupcakes on the "Build your own cupcake" menu are all chocolate. It would be nice if they had a vanilla option too.

Flew in late on Friday night and was craving a salad like no other. Came here around 11pm to kill the craving and it worked!

Ordered:
x Ahi Ceviche (Fresh Raw Ahi Tuna Diced and Marinated in Lime Juice, Chiles and Cilantro. Tossed with Avocado, Tomato, Onion and Cucumber) - shockingly the tuna tasted fresh. Chips were grease-less, crisp, and crunchy. 10\/10 would recommend.
x Seafood Salad (Lump Crab, Shrimp, Avocado, Tomato, Corn, Green Beans, Egg, Celery and Green Onion Over a Bed of Crisp Romaine Tossed with Our "Louis" Dressing) - SOOO much of everything. This salad was HUGEEEE. Shared the two dishes and we were stuffed. Everything was good except the shrimp.. tasted and cut like rubber.

Service was extremely slow, but it's fine considering how HUGE this place is. I've dined at the Grand Lux in Palazzo and this place beats it by far! My 2 star memory now became a 4 star :)

We were going to have a cheap breakfast as breakfast was not included with our stay at the Venetian, however the lines were so long for everything. So due to this, we decided to have breakfast at the Grand Lux. 
The restaurant was fairly busy, but we didn't have any dramas in getting seated. The restaurant was very clean and the wait staff very helpful. Our waiter sort of leaned is towards the all you can eat breakfast buffet which we decided to agree to. 
Let me tell you, the buffet breakfast was awesome. There is not much more I can say about it, except we will definitely come back here next time we are staying on the Las Vegas strip.

i come to the grand lux cafe everytime i visit las vegas! i love how it is conveniently open 24 hours & the food quality is fantastic! so for all the clubbers \/ late night gamblers, this is the place to hit  up! i ussually like all their pastas and their ahi tuna is soooooooooooo delicious!! They offer a lot of different types of dishes on their menu. Great place to eat at if you have picky eaters, because there is something different for everyone's own personal taste.

Nice spot for lunch for a casual dinner. 

Pros:
1) Party of 2 was able to be seated within 5 minutes on a Saturday evening. 
2) Server, Christian was very nice and prompt.
3) Menu was very diverse...a lot of different options...maybe even too many. My opinion is keep the menu simple and focus on quality...but I digress
4) The quality of food matches the prices...You get what you pay for.

Con's:
1) Drinks were a little pricy. My husbands entree was less $$ than my Sangria. 
2) I ordered the margarita pizza and the crust was limp and soggy...not the best.

Pretty good for a Vegas breakfast joint! Had to wait in line, but not too long. The menu is HUGE! We tried eggs, potato hash, creamy spinach and cheese dip(my favorite), seared rare ahi, avocado and heirloom tomato salad, and the grand club sandwich. 

The creamy spinach dip was the best and so was the grand club sandwich. The eggs were great too. 

I didn't like the seared rare ahi. It was wasn't very fresh. I guess that's what you get for ordering sushi in Vegas at a breakfast place!

The salad was refreshing, but just make sure you like the dressing. It's best to request it on the side!

I liked that there were lots of options for everyone. Breakfast ends at 11!

I've eaten here a couple times now. There's nothing specific, so I can't quite place what exactly it is, but I've enjoyed it. It's never over the top great, but I've left here feeling very satisfied.

I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, but it's definitely worth it if you're in the Venetian and don't have better plans.

This is a sister restaurant to Cheesecake Factory so the menu is pretty much the same. I've been coming here for years. We would drive in at 11pm and head straight over for a great late dinner. We love the service here, although the last time I was here they sat us in the patio... wrong move. It's in the casino so, smokers keep walking by and it's more noisy. No patio seating unless you want to people watch and don't mind the smoke. If you're there for Brunch get the Blood Orange Mimosa, Peach Bellini,  and the Brioche French Toast with strawberries... YUMMY!! We love the Chicken Enchiladas and The Crispy Carmel Chicken is my hands down favorite although, it doesn't taste anything like Carmel. Sweet & spicy crispy chicken would be a better name. The Pasta with Chicken, Sun-dried Tomatoes and Mushrooms is also very good.

Wow finally we got to try some good food in Vegas...and it was like our 2nd day here...after the so-so pastrami at Canter Deli in Treasure Island, the okay Earl of Sandwich in Planet Hollywood and the awful buffet of Luxor.....we finally tried something at 1am in the morning on Thursday - a really good burger and sandwich.

So after watching the show Recycled Percussion - which would be my next review.....we hit the casino for a while...and decided to walk to Venetian to try the 24hour Grand Luxe Cafe we heard so much about. And you know what? The garlic- bleu cheese burger and fries were amazing.....even my slow braised short rib grilled cheese sandwich hit the spot. 

I have overloaded on bad white carbs yesterday and today but this was one of the times it was more worth it...and I'll do it again! =) service was wonderful and woohoo for 24hr restaurants that are GOOD!  It's far from our hotel but well the walk was worth it =D definitely recommend this place for some late night munchies and dining. =D I just wish had a bigger appetite to try their other dishes...which I heard everything on their menu is pretty good. The bill came out to be around $30 bucks for two and definitely much more satisfying than the places we have tried so far.

I luv this place!!! Always great service, awesome food and for you night owls this is the place for late night food....... I have been stuck on the pasta with chicken, sun dried tomatoes and mushroom. A-May-Zing!!!!!!!! Asian nachos are a must so come late and hungry, Grand lux won't disappoint

(For the one on the Venetian side, not Pallazzo) 

I love Grand Lux Cafe! [the sister restaurant to The Cheesecake Factory.] It is definitely a must go whenever i'm in Vegas. 

I've always experienced great service every time I've eaten here and don't expect anything less than the friendly and attentive wait staff. This is a great place to go for delicious affordable food and nice atmosphere at any time of the day. -- They're open 24\/7! 

The burgers are absolutely delicious and are HUGE! I always cut them in half and end up eating the second half later on. They also have yummy pasta dishes and soup and sandwich combos. My favorite thing that i ordered was the spicy crispy chicken burger; just the right amount of spice with all the right toppings and served with their tasty french fries! 

I definitely recommend checking this restaurant out whether you're looking for a place for lunch after shopping and walking the strip or a place for dinner before a night on the town!

Grand lux is convenient if your staying at the Venetian or Palazzo. Great food at a reasonable price. big portions, I couldn't finish my food. Great service too!

Visited July 2011

Chicken in waffles!!!! Order it, eat it, savor the flavors, and love life. Pleasantly surprised how tasty this was. The butter and syrup mixer brought this all together. The Mai Tai drink is strong but so good. They use passion fruit juice like elephant bar. Not as tasty as the Elephant bar version but really close.

  Service was great.  My friend has nut allergies and made sure to let our server know that. Her salad arrived full of almonds,  so our server comped her salad for the inconvenience. 

Overall the dining experience was great. Everyone enjoyed their food, it was fresh, hot, flavorful, and large portions. We had buffalo chicken rolls (a must for buffalo chicken fans), entree salads, miso salmon (I recommend subbing the rice for mash potatoes) jambalaya, chicken n waffles,  and a sandwich. 

This place is definitely a go to when in town especially since the location in Los Angeles closed down.
Chicken piccata is awesome and beet goat cheese salad also. Loved their smoothies. Fast service.
Awesome Food\/dessert... Reasonable price .. Open 25 hours .. Customer service great too .. Highly recommended !!!

Had late nite dinner here. Had the burger with side salad and the portions were huge. Dessert was sticky toffee cake.  This was to die for. But it's quite sweet...warning for those of you who don't like overly sweet. 

Went here for breakfast as well. Had the deluxe breakfast sandwich.  Could have feed two people.  Delicious and filling. 

Service was on point.

Went there recently for my birthday with a party of 6. Service was great and the food was amazing. I had the beef Wellington which was the best I have had anywhere. From the pot pie to the short rib spaghetti everyone's meals was excellent. This place was so great we were even debating going back the next morning for breakfast. I would say this is a hidden gem on the strip.

It's like an upscale Cheesecake Factory with a similar ginormous\/extensive menu.  My family and I were staying at The Venetian for the week and decided to have a quick dinner here one night.  We were all too full from lunch to get our own entrees so we shared three:  Spaghettini w\/ Clams and Rock Shrimp (white wine sauce yaddah yaddah yaddah) [the shrimp were disappointing because of their blah texture from being overcooked], Grilled Chicken and Avocado Salad [YUM!!], and the Pasta Carbonara [probably the best I've had].

The first thing I look for at any breakfast place is their french toast. And the sole reason why we ate breakfast here was the churro french toast. It did not disappoint. Fair warning, it must be shared, because it is simply too rich and amazing to enjoy by yourself. I ate one slice and I was satisfied. I even had it cold during a midnight snack and it was still good. Then I ate it again the following morning lol. My boyfriend had the chilaquiles which were alright but he's also mexican and  knows what chilaquiles should taste like. But everyone knows not to order a mexican dish at an american establishment. So dont order it!
I love this place! The portions are huge, service is always great and the chocolate cake is to die for!!

This was a place I enjoyed coming too I know this is Vegas so it will always be busy and my review doesn't matter here but I just had a awful experience my waiters were fighting and giving the attitude towards us when they were confused about a swift change! Whoever Enrique is should be fired he was rude and I was made to feel to leave and that my order and service would not be done with care!

Our second visit here - the first was a late night dinner after Phantom in June and the Short Rib Grilled Cheese sandwich ($13.50) was so memorable, I had to get it again! Although their horseradish sauce could use A LOT more horseradish - they probably have to make it super mild for middle America.

This place is really affordable for Vegas standards.  Lunch or dinner under $40.00.  Some other great dishes here are the Sicilian Pasta ($10.95) and the Short Rib Shepherds Pie ($14.95).  They start you off with fresh sourdough bread, hot from the oven and the iced tea is fresh brewed.  The menu is giant, just like it's parent company The Cheesecake Factory. Definitely a satisfying meal that's easy on the wallet!

Great portion for the price! 

I saw reviews talking about a wait but on a Saturday around 11:30 am, we waited in line for about 10-15mins and then got seated. It's definitely like a Cheesecake Factory, from the large variety of menu items to the decor. Our server was really friendly.

I got the Garlic Shrimp Pasta and my boyfriend got the Carolina BBQ Sandwich. Garlic Shrimp Pasta was close to $20 but so worth it. It's saucy once you stir it all together and the shrimp was good and completely peeled. It looks like the sauce would be light but it actually tastes pretty heavy\/creamy so I didn't eat a whole lot. I took like 2\/3 of it as leftovers. My boyfriend really enjoyed his sandwich. It came with extra cole slaw on the side which he liked and the french fries were good; slightly crispy. He also took half his sandwich home too. 

Overall, we enjoyed the meal here and would come back if we're feeling different types of food since the variety is great here. It's casual, has lots of seating, and gets you full!

One word: Dependable!

We ate here 2-3 times on our business trip to Las Vegas. We always seemed to gravitate to this restaurant...we couldn't help it. It's dependable. The food is good and this place always seems to be open!

The first time I came here, I was having lunch. I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich. It wasn't the best I have ever had, but it was good. It just was a lot of breading and a lot of bread to eat at once. The second time I came, it was after a party...so everyone in our party was looking for a late night fix. I ordered a ham and cheese omelet. It was pretty good.

Nothing TOO much to say here. If you have been to the Cheesecake Factory, it is pretty much just like that. it is a dependable place with tons of choices for everyone in your party.

I'm in Vegas, pregnant, and starving. What do I do? Yelp of course! I just got out of watching La Reve, which by the way was amazing, but I'll save that for another review.  Found this 24\/7 cafe in the Venetian and said hell yeah. Waddled all the way there, got sat right away and didn't know what to order. It didn't help that their menu was so large, and we had only 5 minutes before we couldn't order off the diner menu. Our server was really friendly, and understood our time crunch so she came back to check on us immediately after getting our waters. Too bad we cracked under pressure and went for the late night menu, which had almost the same items. 

My bf and I went back and forth between the chicken fettuccine or the chicken mushroom pasta. Finally, we flipped a coin and went for the fettuccine. Boy, we were not disappointed. The fettuccine was the perfect amount for two and it was not too creamy nor dry. We added cheese and crushed peppers to it as well. Sharing goes along way, so we decided to grab dessert too. We had the red velvet cake and it was so huge we couldn't even finish it. We were in heaven..... so much, I came back on our last night to eat here again! 

This time we had the chicken mushroom pasta, which was alright. Not my cup of tea but still edible. We came during dinner time and got bread and butter. Then we decided skip dessert and do an appetizer this time. We got the Asian nachos, and it was so different and unique. Something we never tasted, and it was so big, I was full eating the pasta. Crispy fried wontons topped with melted cheese, grilled chickens, fried rice, green onions, and peanut and wasabi drizzled. 

Service was on point both times, the waitresses always checked up on us, asked how we were doing, and never kept us waiting too long for our refills and the check!

There is not better place in Las Vegas for drunk, late-night, affordable food.  Grand Lux is good for breakfast, its good for lunch, its great for late night, and we will always come back here when we need a food fix and don't want crappy food from some dumpy strip location.

Trendy cafe in the heart of the Venetian.

Friendly servers.  Tasty drinks.  Good food and GREAT desserts.

Can get pretty packed during meal hours, but stays open and is fantastic for a bite after 9PM.

4 stars!

HAD THE MAX BURGER!!!! OMG! SOOOOOOOOO F'IN GOOD! Certified Angus Beef Topped with Cheddar Cheese, Crisp Bacon,
Mushrooms, Onions and Roasted Short Ribs. Served with Fries. WHAT?!?! a burger with roasted short ribs?! I should've added avocado on that thing! one of the best burgers I've had...and it was a nice big burger. I couldn't finish it (I normally finish all my food and then some). Downfall is...it took a real long time for them to get our food out. Our waiter was nice...but he never gave us bread! :( I'd come back though and have another Max burger!

This little gem in the Venetian served the best meal I had in Vegas for this trip! I had the Chicken Parm and it was so good, nice big portion, the chicken was tender and the cheese, pasta and sauce just right! 

My friends all enjoyed their meals as well. You can't go wrong here, great value for your money, I hope they do not change the quality and portions of the food because I will be back every time I go to Vegas. Excellent.
Owned by same owners as Cheesecake Factory....enough said.  Too many other places to eat in LV to eat there.

3.5 stars, but they get 4 from me since the grilled chicken was super juicy!

My friends and I came here around 9:30pm to grab dinner before clubbing. It took about 10 minutes to be seated, which wasn't bad considering it was extremely packed. It took awhile for our food to arrive, so this may not be the place to dine if you are in a hurry to get somewhere.

We saw how large the portions were, so my friend and I shared the Pasta with Grilled Chicken, Tomato, Basil & Mozzarella. The grilled chicken wasn't dry at all. I was surprised at how juicy it was considering it was white meat! I couldn't finish even though we shared. Definitely kept me full the rest of the night.

Yelp reviews said this was the sister restaurant of The Cheesecake Factory, so we kept comparing the two. I think I like this one better! We saw the next table's Shrimp Scampi and that looked absolutely delicious! Dine here if you want good quality and portions for the price!

I went to the one in the Palazzo and it was delicious! Portions were way too big but i'd rather have them too big than too small. you would think a restaurant right off the casino would be kinda iffy, but my entire party were impressed. the drinks, entrees, and desserts were excellent!

We ate here twice in our stay at the Venetian.   Both the breakfast and dinner menu is extensive, with several vegetarian options.   The food is good but nothing profound.   Both times we ate here the servers were total pros.    The man who served us dinner was friendly and attentive.  The woman who served us breakfast was a phenom.    She poured the first cup of coffee with room for cream, then came back to check before it was half empty.   When it was down to 1\/4 she noticed I take it black and filled it all the way.    She was right there when we needed her and disappeared when my friend and I were chatting.    Stellar service, I would definitely eat here again and send my friends here any time of day.

I'm from Houston , and visit the glc location here often. Of course when I'm in Vegas, I eat here! 

I've stayed in the Venetian twice, and both times dined here, it's just that good.

This last time, I celebrated my 10 year anniversary and renewed our vows... Dinner reception was here of course. I had no issues reserving a table for 12, and enjoyed our dinner . Great service, and great food. The menu is very diverse, from tacos and burgers, to pasta and salads.  There's even a breakfast\/brunch buffet in the morning for $18... It includes coffee and juice too!

I love this place, it's just plain delicious.

If you like Cheesecake Factory, you will love this place!! Its like going to CF but having different items to choose from! I love it! Stayed at the Venetian 4 days and everyday found time to eat here whether it was breakfast, lunch, dinner, or late night!! 

Another plus is that if you are staying at the Venetian, its right next to the Guest Elevators, and in between you have Gigi's Cupcakes and that other bakery so you can take dessert back to your room :-)

Excellent food.  Open 24 hours.  Don't let them fool you by saying breakfast only gets served to 11am as they have an all day breakfast menu that is fairly large.  This place is just perfect for hangover comfort food.

What a nice surprise in Vegas .  I absolutely love this place .  Honestly this is the best restaurant in Vegas for bang for your buck .  I ate here all 3 days of my stay and had steak and eggs for breakfast . Less than 20 bucks and cooked to perfection . I also tried the bloody Mary's and they were just as good as well!

Grand Lux Cafe isn't your typical cafe with the typical diner type items. It's actually a classier looking restaurant that has a huge resemblance to Cheesecake Factory. And after speaking to our waitress, we found out they had the same owner. The food is similar too but in my opinion, the quality is much much better here at the Grand Luxe. 

For appetizers, the BF and I shared crabcakes which were sooo sooooooo goood! Loved the dipping sauce that came with it and the crabcake itself had perfect texture and flavor. Couldn't remember the cocktails we had but we loved them too - got us a pretty nice buzz going even before our main course.

For our main dish, I ordered the Miso Glazed Salmon and the BF had the Pasta with Chicken, Sun-Dried Tomato and Mushrooms tossed lightly in a garlic, creamy, parmesan cheese sauce. Both were superb in taste! 

Best part about this place? It opens 24 hours! Woooohoooo! Definitely a big plus when we stay at the Venetian! Helps with my usual late night munchies =)

Okay so it's my husbands bday and first restaurant we thought of trying didn't seem appetizing so we wandered in the Grand Lux Cafe. We ordered the Bourbon Chicken and the Smothered Catfish. We modified the catfish dish and used the Bourbon chicken sauce and fried shrimp instead of sauteed shrimp. Husband loved the catfish. He called it heaven on a plate. Every bite was awesome. Our waiter: Jose Castaneda. If he's working make sure to ask for him. Hands down he was the most attentive, professional waiter and he made wonderful suggestions. Planning on coming back later tonight because the service Jose provided and the meal he helped us modify was the best we've had in Vegas. Thanks Jose!!!

So basically we go to vegas at 11:40 PM, went clubbing immediately after checking in. Did that until 4 AM, wandered and met up with friends at around 6 AM, and decided we needed some grub. Did I mention we didn't eat since about 6 PM the day before? 

We were basically starving zombies in need of nourishment. Someone recommended this place and what a great idea! I'm not sure was it the hunger, the alcohol at the club, or the zombification feeling I had, but my order was awesome. I got some sort of omelet. I want to say a california omelet, but I'm not sure. I know there was sour cream, avocado, and tomatoes. Whatever omelet I got, it was soooooo tasty. This was one of the best omelets I have ever eaten. My group seemed to agree and they all loved their dishes (3 got omelets and 1 got a breakfast sandwich). 

I would definitely come back for their omelet.

Put me in Grand Lux Cafe or a Cheesecake Factory location and slight decor differences aside, they are pretty much identical. Whether it's the atmosphere, the decor, the staff and the menu, these two are pretty much identical. 

It's weird too, because as I entered the Venetian and was seeking for a place to eat that was affordable and quick (I had to head to the Blue Man Group show and only had one hour to eat), everyone told me that this Cheesecake Factory-like restaurant was around the corner. When they said that it was similar, I had no idea what I was in for and how much of a clone it really was. Stunning but neat.

So we proceeded to walk in and get seated and a very friendly waiter took care of us. We ordered some stiff drinks, 2 Scotchs, on the rocks. Then while my grandfather 'carbed up' with a clam pasta dish, I went for one of their big salads; in this case it was their Chopped salad - grilled chicken, bacon, tomatoes, blue cheese, avocado, egg and mixed greens. The whole thing was tossed in a vinaigrette. 

The food came out from the kitchen in under fifteen minutes. The clam pasta dish according to my grandfather was very tasty and the clams very fresh. The salad was large and despite my best attempts, I could not finish it. The dressing complimented the rest of the ingredients well and I didn't feel heavy from eating it. The service was great and the prices were great as well.

Overall this place is a nice addition to the Venetian. It provides reasonably good food at good prices and with good service. It's reliable and their menu is varied enough to satisfy all kinds of appetite. I didn't however find it to be as good as any Cheesecake Factory location I've been to. It's less tacky though which is a good thing.

Been there for the third time today, never been disappointed. The Caesar salad is delicious and a good portion, my friend always gets the turkey club sandwich and their fries are absolutely amazing some of the best I've had, and today I got the pasta carbonara and it was so good! Good atmosphere good food, definitely  recommended

Basically an upscale Cheesecake Factory!  Same exact menu, with a touch of Vegas. What I love about this place is that it's open 24\/7! Always great walking out of a club in the early morning and being able to get some good food at a nice restaurant. The service this last time was a little dodgy (rude waiter), but this may have been a one-off. The food is as good as can be expected from a glorified Cheesecake Factory, but it gets the job done. Enjoy!

This place never lets me down and I always try to come at least one time when I'm in Vegas.   Today (Sunday), we came after our first choice had a long,  long brunch-time wait.  My friend had the chicken and waffles,  which she often gets.  She said they seem to have changed\/improved the chicken!  I had the Korean "burrito."  It's a chicken wrap with crispy fried chicken.   Fabulous!

Came to Grand Lux Cafe located inside the Venetian Hotel on Saturday night after clubbing at 1Oak. Our party was hungry so we thought we would come here to get some chicken and waffles! This restaurant is open 24 hours so it's convenient for after-party grub! I heard that it's the same owners as the Cheesecake Factory and you'll see a few similarities.

Their chicken and waffles $13.95 are amazing!!! The waffle is very fluffy on the inside and the exterior has a slight crisp to it! I LOVED IT! They also pile on chicken strips.

I love that they serve bread and butter with the meal too! Bread and butter makes the restaurant so much better I think ha ha

Our server Ahmat?( I think that's his name) was very attentive! He was great! When we asked for to-go boxes he even went out of his way to pack syrups for us without us having to ask! He was awesome!

Definitely make this your stop after a long night of clubbing or gambling! It's way better than the fast food options!

Since we were staying at the Venetian, this cafe was convenient for a late night meal after doing some serious gambling.

I am somewhat torn on a rating though so I have actually averaged the food and the service.

We ate there three times during our stay. The food was always top notch. I had the Lux Breakfast Sandwich twice and a burger once. I have to give the food 5 stars.

The service on the other hand was poor, 2 out of 3 times. The first night we had a female server who was prompt, courteous and kept reappearing to fill up my water glass. The other 2 times, the male servers would disappear for long stretches. I had to repeatedly ask for more water and once they refilled my glass but not my wife's.

I would eat here again if I was staying at the Venetian but wouldn't make a special trip since the service is lacking.

So i came here about 3 times total the whole weekend i was in Las vegas. Its convieniently located inside the Palazzo where we stayed. Its open late and everything that I tried the 3 different times i came here were really good except for the BLT sandwich. That was a bit dry. Other than that you cant really go wrong with anything else. 

I tried the pizza, chicken and waffles, pasta, grilled chicken sandwich, shaken beef, calamari, crab cake. and the raw tuna. My favorites were the pasta and crab cake!! You have to try the crab cakes here, they are delicious! 

great food! HUGE portions! and open late! i would agree with the other reviews and say its better than cheesecake.
Food was fine, service was fine, hit the spot
Great place sure its bought by cheese cake but taste isn't anything like cheese cake. It taste even much better.

After eating at many top notch restaurants and dropping a couple hundies having dinner for two and being mildly impressed, I discovered the Grand Lux.  The menu was so vast that there is something for everyone. I ended up coming here for three meals during my week long stay in Vegas. 

I had a Grand Lux Omlette for breakfast, which came with asparagus, Artichoke, Oven-Dried Tomato, Portabella Mushrooms and Havarti Cheese. I asked for the hollondaise sauce on the side.  Also came with choice of hashbrowns or tomatoe\/lettuce and choice of bread. I went for the tomatoe\/lettuce and an english muffin.  It tasted perfect!  If you like cream cheese, ask for some because they make it fresh and boy it is gooooood!

As for the other two meals, I had the the Manhattan salad for dinner. The portion was huge, I had to take half of it to go.  It was a chopped salad with Romaine Lettuce, Asparagus, Tomato, White Beans, Fresh Beets, Red Onion, Peas, Lentils and Assorted Vegetables tossed in Our House Vinaigrette with chopped fresh turkey and cheese. I loved it!!!
The other meal was the sonoma salad which didn't stand up to the Manhattan.  

Meals cost between 10-20 bucks.  They have great lunch specials that are really dinner sized portions.  

You can't go wrong at the Grand Lux. It's located centrally inside the Venetian and open late.  Service was great each time!

I checked out the Grand Lux Cafe twice during my weeklong stay in LV. I went the first time because it was near my hotel and was relatively affordable. I went the second time because the first meal was that good.

The GLC gives off the vibe of an upscale diner. It has a large and diverse menu, which covers all sorts of different options for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. It's also open 24 hours. The price point is really reasonable for LV - anywhere from $10-$20 for the average meal. The server also told me that the pasta portions are gigantic, though I didn't have pasta when I was there.

The first time I went to GLC was on a weeknight. It wasn't busy, and I got a table immediately. I ordered the Grand Lux Burger Melt with fries, which was quite delicious. The burger was cooked very well. The fries were a little soggy, but not too bad. The portion size was reasonable for the cost. They also give you bread as you're waiting for your meal, and the bread was freshly baked and warm, which I appreciated.

The second time I went to the GLC was on a Friday for lunch. The place was packed with a line out of the restaurant. However, the line moved fairly quickly, and I got a table within ten minutes of getting in line.

I ordered the chicken and waffles, and let me tell you, that was outstanding. Huge waffle. Really flavorful and moist chicken. The Pecan Honey-Butter Sauce was delicious, and the waffle itself was covered in pecans to add some texture that I enjoyed. It was also very reasonably priced for lunch fare.

Why am I not giving this a five star rating?

Simply, the wait time from the order to having the meal served was too long. On Tuesday, I waited at least 1\/2 an hour to get the burger, and on Friday, it took even longer than that. If it's busy, I can understand that. The size of their menu, which is quite massive and diverse, certainly adds additional challenges. However, the place was dead on weeknight and I still waited too long. That knocks it down a bit.

Otherwise, I'd definitely recommend it.

Had the best crab omlette, I wanted to be healthy but ate all my friends hash browns and her breakfast sandwich! I recommend this place highly! They were pretty fast and the service was really good. The food is a lot, I have a large tummy so I can eat it all,m but if you don't I recommend you split

Came to this location for the first time for dinner with my fiancé. We actually left our credit card here and they held it graciously and honestly for several hours until we returned. Aside from that side note the service was great and the food was fresh and cooked well. We enjoyed our visit here and will be coming back soon!

I always have great food here and excellent service. My recent trip to Vegas, I could not find good food in my hotel so I made a special trip on the other side of the strip just to eat here. Waiter was great; food was great!

Food was very tasty.  Ordered the Sunday night pasta which was hearty and hit the spot.  Service was somewhat slow.  Server asked how was everything tasting even though she could see we hadn't even taken a bite.  

Prices are high for the overall experience.

would always eat here if i'm staying at venetian\/palazoo.

ur basically looking at a cheese cake factory clone, except that you're a 10 second walk away to blowing your paycheck right after dinner.

tried most of the stuff on the menu and the only things i didnt really like would be their chicken salad sandwich and their pho-like noodle dish. can't go wrong with their burgers or their pastas. unless your on a diet.

protip: get that grazie card, save me a 1.5 hour wait this past weeeknd. they have a separate line for grazie members. for any stingy readers, grazie club card=free. free=good.
Got the breakfast sandwich and it was great, as were the hash browns.  Price was reasonable and great for being in the Venetian.  Service was a little slow to refill waters but it was crowded.

same company as cheesecake factory

same kind of food, but with a fancy twist , and no cheesecakes here

great food, huge portions, big clean atmosphere with friendly staff

We stayed at the New York New York hotel and checked out the menu for this restaurant before leaving. We walked the 2 1\/2 miles to get to the restaurant only to be told that they do not have mahi-mahi on their menu.they remove the mahi-mahi bring their menu six months ago. Boy that was disappointing. Then we asked him about the beignets for dessert. Again another disappointing response from the waitress. So we decided to eat there anyway since we were already there. The waitress was telling us how most men don't like mushroomsand she asked if we wanted mushrooms with our meal. we said yes. Our mail came and there were no mushrooms. Instead we were told it wasn't mushrooms that they gave us . It was brussels sprouts instead. Let me see mushrooms or brussels sprouts.  We felt cheated and disappointed.  Not a very good experience and another 2.5 miles back. We should have stayed and ate at the hotel.

Don't know if the owners are potheads who always have the munchies, but portions are 3 times more than you expect to be and they're also conveniently open 24 hours a day, with a pretty good drink menu.  Everytime we're in vegas we always seem to eat here, so I definitely recommend it...even if you don't like the kush...

The food was pretty good and I liked how there were a ton of options on their menu. However, the service was alright. Our server only came back once to refill our waters and our food took a while to come out. I mean it wasn't horrible, but it wasn't that great. Besides that, I did enjoy my Spicy Carnitas Sandwich.

went here right after partying @ Body English since we went bak to da venetian cuz dats wer we stayed. went wit a group of friends and we enjoyed  it. portion is big...and service was great considering we wer all drunk (probably annoying too haha) our server was very patient. good place to go after clubbing in vegas.

Average Breakfast - Little Expensive for what you get. 

I hosted 4 people for breakfast and most ordered a traditional Eggs, Hashbrown, bacon\/sausage and toast meal with Coffee or O.J. 

The service was fairly quick, no waiting to sit down, and the food was average - no surprises. 

Bill was a little high topping over $20 per person.
Every time we visit Vegas we have to go to Guy's and have breakfast and a Bloody Mary! They are the best after a night on the town.  The food is excellent!

DO NOT GO HERE!!! We waited for 30 mins for our food!!! All the bread was burnt and then once we returned it to the kitchen! It came bk burnt again!!!

Food is ok but not work the wait! Though the service staff is nice! But the food doesnt stand out atall!

I'm amazed that a coffee shop\/diner type place can be so incredibly great. The food is simple but really good. For example, if you get a turkey club, its on thickly sliced bakery bread with applewood bacon and arugula instead of wonder bread and iceberg. Its open 24 hours a day (which surprisingly, a lot of Vegas restaurants are not). The service is awesome, with frequent refills. Warning: DO NOT order an appetizer, unless its instead of an entree, the portions are huge (more Vegas hotel rooms need mini-fridges for leftovers, meals can be a rel waste).Highly recommended.

There are 2 Grand Lux Cafes in the Venetian so I'm not sure which one this is. We stayed at the Platinum Hotel [awesome] but needed a late night eatery that wasn't Denny's or Micky D's. 

We were all very satisfied with Grand Lux because they have a late night menu that consists of breakfast food, salads, soups, appetizers, pastas and even plain greasy pizza. 

We had 8 hungry girls that had just gone through a long day of driving, surprising our bachelorette, and some car trouble. The Grand Lux that night was like heaven to us. We ate heartily, and then crashed. 

Some of the things we got:

Seared Ahi Tuna Salad
Mushroom Pizza
Eggs, sausage, bacon with toast
Omelettes

Love the one in Los Angeles and LOVE this one too. Our waiter went out of his way to complete what I ordered which was not on the menu. Seared Ahi tuni steak in a lemon butter sauce. It was amazing and made perfectly. We brought some new friends with us and they loved it too. Never disappoints. Love the buffalo chicken rolls, potato spring rolls. crispy ahi rolls and the Grand Lux Melt Burger :) Its all sooooo good !! PICK THIS LOCATION NOT THE PALAZZO LOCATION

Oh Grand Lux how I love thee. 
You are always there when I need you to be.
You deal with my drunken habits,
 and your waitresses never look saddened.
"Avocado Omelet!!!" is all I have to say for you to recognize my favorite plate,
from a great place, if you ever need to eat late, late, late.

This place is just like Cheesecake Factory. Actually...it is owned by the same company! I like Cheesecake Factory so I liked this place. It's very very similar. The menu is a lil bit different and the price is about the same. The interior and decor is about the same also.

Great place to dine if you have no where else to go. But this wouldn't be my first choice since there are other places that are better and is unique to only Vegas.

Hands down. The best bang for your buck!Just like the cheesecake Factory, this place is one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas maybe even the country.The portions are great. The menu is awesome. The service is excellent. What else could you ask for?
My personal favorite is the shrimp scampi, you cannot go wrong with this dish, just perfect. The appetizers are delicious and imaginative. I do not think it is possible to have a bad meal at this place.
They served my wife the worst eggs benedict she had ever had in her life, on top of which they were cold. the scrambled eggs in the buffet looked like they had been sitting there for 6 hours.
Solid. Open 24\/7 and large portions. Perfect for after the club or early risers. I love the Asian Nachos.

I think this is the only restaurant in Wynn that is open until the wee hours of the morning. We rolled in with a group of 7 and were seated in less than ten minutes. 

I got the short rib sloppy joe. I had high expectations as I love sloppy joes. Every once and a while, I get a strong craving for a good old fashion joe...you know the ones that were served in elementary school. 

The meat was okay. Nothing to rave about. It could have been ground beef for all I know. 

The sloppy joe could have been improved in two ways: 1) more sauce and 2) hamburger bread. I did not enjoy eating a dry sloppy joe on a toasted piece of bread. 

Towards the end, my entire party crashed, while I handled the bill. Service was friendly but a bit slow. I struggled to stay awake, while I waited for what seemed like an eternity for the waitress to return with the receipt.

The Grand Lux Burger Melt is the best sandwich I've ever eaten!  Grilled onions, toasted bread, perfectly cooked beef, melty cheesy goodness, and.... wait for it.... thousand island dressing.  Mmmmmmm......
It's okay, there wasn't anything there that really impressed me. I'd go again but I wouldnt go out of my way to eat there if you know what I mean.

This place is great! The food and prices are really good and the service is incredible. The menu is huge and everything we tasted was delicious. The breakfast buffet is also very good. Don't be scared of the long line because service is very fast, so the wait is short.

Been here twice since it's conveniently at palazzo.

Service has been great so far and the food is bomb.
Cafe beef Wellington and almond crusted trout are amazing like I just wanted to sit here and eat it forever but I'm a small little Asian girl so dat not gonna happen.

Had a bunch of other stuff too but can't remember what they were tbh... it was good though.. just not noteworthy I guess *hehe

This restaurant has never fail on my Dinner every time I go  with my family the food is always delicious and a great experience  
I'm very happy with Yesterday Dinner was Delicious 
The restaurant was very clean 
The host,waitress ,and the rest of the staff was very nice specially a Spanish speaker man he took care of Us and made sure we had everything we needed

This place is located in the Palazzo. I had breakfast here and ordered the egg white omelette with bacon, onion, and sausage. This was very fresh and savory. It wasn't oily like your typical restaurant or cafe you go to. The bacon, onion, and sausage was cooked and placed inside the egg white so it almost looked like a taco. This came with hash browns that was cooked perfectly, since it had the right amount of burning on the top.

Believe all the hype\/other reviewers as this place is REALLY fantastic. Two people for $100 gets you an outstanding meal with tons of dinner choices. 5\/5 stars as the same quality elsewhere would be double the price. TIP: portions are huge so share!
One of the best veggie bugers ive ever had!  YUMMMM and the fries are good too!! thank god its 24 hr!

Excellent food. Prices were very fair. This is better than Cheesecake Factory although with the same theme.

Loved the Mahi Mahi. The menu is pretty big - lots of different items.

Noisy and too many tables.

I read the good and the bad before going. I've been here a few times. 

The good...Close to the Venetian theater (Saw Celtic Women last night). We were seated quickly and served quickly. Our server, Carlina, was EXCELLENT. They have an extensive menu so there is something there for everyone. The prices are extremely reasonable.

Nothing bad (hence the 3 stars), but everything else was just OK. I had the Spaghetti Carbonara and was really disappointed. I kept reminding myself that it wasn't an Italian restaurant and I shouldn't have great expectations. It was dry and greasy. The bacon was too crunchy and some of it burned. I prefer pancetta. I ate half of it and was done. My partner had the chicken tortilla soup. It was average. It seemed as if it was tomato based. Way to creamy.

Oh...there was one bad...The bread. It had no taste. It was too moist in the middle and I cut my gum with the crust. It seemed as if it had been warmed over a couple of times.

As I'm writing this...I'm thinking...try somewhere else before my next show there.
I am not usually into chain restaurants like this during trips.  I actually go here for breakfast and late night dining every-time I am in Vegas. Service is good. Hope they keep up the good work.

This was definitely the spot for business breakfasts and lunches. The establishment was totally packed during these meals during a conference being held at Sands.

With that said, they did a good job handling the crowd and getting meals out and complete in under an hour.

I got the breakfast sandwich with hash browns ($12.50). The sandwich was huge and included tomato, egg, ham, cheese, mayo, and bacon. It was a little greasy but substantial. The hash browns were also a bit greasy and needed salt.

Either way, it served an important function for the conference and the Venetian, that's for sure.
Bakers dozen !! That's all i have to say. Yummmiiii

I love this restaurant! My boyfriend and I have this tradition of eating our first meal here everytime we visit Vegas! There is actually another Grand Lux in Beverly Hills but I think the one at the Venetian is much nicer!

Anyway, I love this establishment for the excellent service they provide. The waiters are always willing to answer questions, refill your drinks, suggest or recommend a meal...i mean...they have a very attentive waitstaff. 

Their menu is pretty long and it usually takes me a while to get through the whole thing and decide. Everything sounds delicious! I love their complementary wheat roll...mmmm...always wrapped in that warm napkin. Mmmm...kay i'm getting hungry! Their sangria is served in a tall glass and oooh...they serve it pretty stiff! 

Ahhh...can't wait til the next time!

Have eaten here many times before usually for breakfast.  It's in the Palazzo Resort & Casino, one of my favorite Hotel Casino in LV.  The food is good, expect to pay a bit more if you order a la cart.  Better to go for the breakfast buffet.  The pastries are delicious and the breakfast meals are batches cooked therefore it's fresh when it's replenished. Always a good thing.  One less star for the service category.  It's a hot or miss from my experience but overall a great choice for breakfast and lunch.

We opted to order breakfast off the menu rather than hit the buffet.  I think it was a good move, as the blueberry pancakes were great and the scrambled eggs were fresh (but covered in butter).  Also, if you like smoothies, they make them in nice tall glasses here; we saw a lot of them on diners' tables and tried the mango one.  Quite yummy!

Open 24 hours in the Venetian.

Good food for a 24 hour joint.  Better than I expected.  Wouldn't even give a second thought to eating here again.

Since we were staying at the Venetian on our last trip to Las Vegas, it makes logical sense that we ended up eating at the Grand Lux Cafe. In fact, after wandering around the casino one night we even discovered that there are two spread out between both the Venetian and Palazzo hotels. Our experience dining at the Venetian Grand Lux Cafe was overall very good as we were able to get seated right away and the quality of our food was perhaps even better than expected. We began with buffalo chicken egg roll appetizers, which were incredible and highly recommendable as a starter that would also pair well with beer. I decided to order a garlic shrimp pasta dish and my partner in crime ordered a strip steak--both meals that I wouldn't say we order on a regular basis when we go out to eat. Once our food came out, we were very impressed as my pasta tasted incredible and his steak was cooked to perfection and seasoned exquisitely. It actually made me happy that we ended up at Grand Lux Cafe rather than a steakhouse, where he would have definitely paid $50.00 for a steak that would have been similar in quality. 

Overall, good service, great food, decent atmosphere, and prices that are better than some of the other more high-end restaurants within the Venetian\/Palazzo means that if you find yourself staying at either of these hotels, I would recommend stopping by Grand Lux Cafe. The menu is large enough that if you find yourself in a big party, everyone should be happy eating here. And of course it is centrally located within the casino, which for Las Vegas is another plus.

please be aware that there are 2 grand lux cafes. one located at the venetian side and one located at the palazzo side. this is an excellent choice for breakfast (assorted pastries with drink).. FOR FREE! yes that's right i said FREE. i received enough free breakfast coupons at check in from the front desk for all 4 of us in my group to eat here every morning we stayed at the venetian for 5 days. this one is locatred on the first floor right by the phantom of opera theatre. we came here twice for breakfast (wasted the other coupons, sigh) and had the continental breakfast (valued at $8 per person on our bill but was $0 for us). it came with a drink selection and a small fruit dish with 3 assorted pastries that changed based on the day you came. the coupon also gave me an option of eating the buffet breakfast which would have been $10 a person with the coupon. the lines are never longer than a 10-15min wait although it may look like a super long wait, but that's also because i was here off season in december before the holidays. i think they have a line separate for grazie members although i didnt discover that til after eating there. (free to join). we just left tip based on the value of the breakfast. cheapest\/best way to eat breakfast in vegas!
This review is just for the side of french fries.  The best french fries East of Balthazar in NYC.

Hit this spot at 4am and it was packed.  Food is DELICIOUS and reasonably priced.  The fish and chips were very favorable and surprisingly not greasy.  My husband had the chicken and waffles and both were phenomenal! The waffles were light, perfectly crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside...BOMB!  The chicken was full of flavor.  Our server was Mike and he was on point!  My husband and I cannot recall the last time we had GREAT service and by all staff. This place will be a regular future stop on our Vegas visits!  Highly recommended!

Disappointing that such a large chain would have such a limited gluten-free menu and the wait staff are uneducated about what gluten is.

Enough said.

Maaaaaaaaaaaannnnn...I can have this place all morning, all night, alllll dayyyyy long!!!

EVERYTIME I'M IN VEGAS it is a TOTAL MUSTTT to have Grand Lux. The breakfast is delicioussss..the caramel chicken is to die for, the chicken flautas are tastyy..the chicken and waffles was interestingly and suprisingly GOOOOD!!!!

I loveee the service, they have a wide selection of food and open late after those late night club hopping nights...The one in Beverly Hills totally sucks but this is the place to eat if your gonna be in Vegas..I have to say I would do Grand Lux over any buffet in Vegas anyyyday!!!!

Nice place to get a quick bite at somewhat reasonable prices.  The Lemon Chicken Piccata ordered from the lunch menu was very flavorful (cheaper price due to lunch specials from 11am til 5pm); however, while the chicken was tender and excellent, the sauce was heavy and anywhere the sauce wasn't touching the pasta was slightly hard, thus obviously had been sitting under the warming light for a few.  The service, while good, was not up to par for the price we paid.  

However, I feel this restaurant provides a huge number of options that could please everyone.  If you were to go at prime time meal service (instead of 3:30pm), I imagine the food and service would be spot on.

This is a review for the Grand Lux Cafe in the Venetian.  There is an identical one in the Palazzo.  So, what more is there to be said here.  I had the opportunity to taste 3 of their tasty treats: the chicken pot pie, a Polynesian salad and a spaghetti dish with chicken.  All in all, each dish was good.  The chicken pot pie was flavorful.  The Polynesian salad was savory, and the spaghetti dish had a nice tomato sauce.  I am really giving it 3 1\/2 stars, but it is not quite at the "fan" level for me.  So, if you're tired of the buffet gorging, this would be a nice alternative.

After trying to find a reasonable breakfast joint on the strip, my group and I walked downstairs and realized this Cafe in out hotel had just what we were looking for. Seating was instant, although they require all your party members to be present for you to write your name down. 

They didn't seem that busy\/crowded when we came  but the service was pretty slow. Although our food took a while to come out that's not what bothered me, it was the 15 minutes of awkwardly waiting to ask for our check. I mean the server was nice, but we just rarely saw her. 

I ordered the chilaquiles because they're always my breakfast go to. I appreciated the plentiful avocados on it, but overall it was a disappointing dish. There was hardly any salsa on it to soften my chips. They seemed more like nachos if anything. Flavor was good, but the texture was way to crunchy for chilaquiles. 

I'd consider trying their dinner dishes, because their breakfast seems just average.

Massive portion size and its very good food. Great veggie options too. If I recall correctly, it is open 24\/7 but then again so is almost everything in Vegas! Didn't get to try the desserts so that's next on the agenda.

Short 10 min wait to be seated, service was good but food was very bland. We tried the stuffed French toast, biscuits and gravy and omelettes. The portions were as expected by the flavors were missing. Everyone at my table (4 people) were disappointed in our dishes. The grand lux at The palazzo was so much better.

Went there last night with a friend. I ordered 3 way Salmon and it was no cocked in the middle. It was completely pink. The manager offered to make another one. He apologized and brought another one. He said he is going to check on me in few min. Few min later he came by and I cut two pieces in-half and it was worse than the first dish. He was embarrassed anapologized and wanted to get me another dish but at that time I lost my appetite.  I miss the Grand Lux cafe in LA it was awesome. This is the second time this location at Vegas was terrible. Last time we got there after midnight and all our dishes was greasy and terrible as well. I love the place but they really need to train their chef much better.

Had breakfast here and it was nice and satisfying. As stated by other yelp review, this place reminds me of a Cheesecake Factory with regard of food selection and portion. I asked for asparagus, mushrooms and tomatoes as an add on for my egg and hash breakfast, and I got a large portion of each. I was charged the price of a veggie omelette, which was nice. The service was friendly and really fast in comparison to the Bouchon.

While the Grand Lux has better bang for the buck, and the veggie omelette and selection were better, I would say the Bouchon has much better bread.

Fabulous!

I needed an order for take away and fast. Not only did they whip up a Santa Barbara chicken sandwich and my beet salad super quick, but the manager even made me a special fruit cup with strawberries and pineapple chunks, because I don't really care for the mixed fruit cups with grapes and melon.

I appreciate the "custom" customer service experience, the efficiency, and the quality of my meal.

This place gets a ton of traffic, being in a casino, but they really went the extra mile for me.

Although I did not try them, the desserts looked impeccable! They have a  beautiful lemon meringue tart that is about 7" high!
Been eating here for years. It all started in Dallas. I have been going to the grand lux since 2007 so I have seen the menu change all these years.
Food is always good. Service was slow today. Not up to normal standard. Asian Nachos are the bomb.

Found this place on yelp actually, they were still serving breakfast around noon and I went for the omelette, my date had eggs\/bacon hashbrowns. I ended up adding an extra 3-4 items to my omelette, idk how they fit it all in there, but it was delicious.

By leaps and bounds this was the worst experience of my 5 days in Vegas. I consider myself a somewhat optimistic person, but I am at a complete loss for positive things to say about this place. I went here at brunch\/lunch time to grab a quick bite before heading back to a conference, and I now wish I would've made the walk to McDonalds so I would've had some quality food and service - you heard right, McDs is quality compared to this junk.

My friends both ordered omelettes and I went with a chicken sandwich that involved avocados. The food wouldn't have even been all that bad if they wouldn't have... A) taken 25 minutes to deliver the goods, B) forgotten to tell us that they messed up our order and needed a few extra minutes, C) neglected to explain their mistake, D) placed my food under the warmer so that my bun became burnt and my lettuce an ever-appetizing wilty black, E) neglected to say one more word to us the entire meal - not even thank you.

Sometimes a restaurant delivers crappy food but the service makes up for the mistakes, and sometimes a black hole emerges in the kitchen and maliciously sucks in every hint of good service and humanity of the entire staff. I probably should have expected all of this knowing that the restaurant the bastard child of Cheesecake Factory, but that damned blind optimism got the best of me. Spend the extra cash and go somewhere else, or go to the food court and get a respectable panini, or just don't eat and get a martini instead - any option is a step in the right direction as long as it is a step away from Grand Lux.

Also, a side note - there was something like 200 items to order from on this menu, meaning that I can rest assured that the entrees have been frozen longer than Ted Williams, yum yum.

The whole time I was here I felt like I was at Cheesecake Factory. We ordered two salads, a southwestern and a manhattan salad. Very large portions, yummy bread and decent service. 

Casual lunch\/dinner restaurant at the Venetian.

Great place to have a meal at the Venetian! Service was exceptional, and they were very accommodating for my gluten intolerance. The menu is well labeled for gluten free options and they also have a great cocktail selection. We were seated in their 'outside' area so we did some good Vegas people watching! 

Food was great, price was normal for Vegas to be honest, and the menu has something for everyone for all tastes!

I called ahead for wait time, the hostesses sounded like she was half sleep. When we got there there were 2 lines and no one knew what to do. I walked up and the half-sleeping hostess quoted me 10-15 minutes. We waited in line for 30 minutes and they sat us at 12:05. We had gone there for breakfast, the server refused to serve breakfast because it was 5 mintues past 12.

I grabbed a salad from here for dinner four different nights during my stay at the Venetian. The staff was genuinely friendly and the prices were very reasonable for Vegas. The Grand Lux Cafe is the place to go for breakfast, lunch or dinner if you want an easy and inexpensive meal.

Crisanto was the best waiter I have ever had in my life! I would come back simply for him! He was more than helpful and superb at his job! It is owned by Cheesecake Factory so I was already expecting great tasting food! BUT oh my goodness was the food good! My boyfriend and I got the fried calamari for an appetizer which was soooooo good! huge portions too! I ordered a Santa Barbara Chicken Sandwich and my beau ordered the Modern Cuban Sandwich! BOTH TASTED HEAVENLY! Modern Cuban is a must! Overall I would come back here before anywhere, and if Crisanto is my waiter! :)

best omelette in a long time though it would of been watery with all the veggies but no not at all it was grate the hash brown were good too don't think there were the frozen kind now the server sucked gave attitude when ask questions about the menu had to ask different servers to get refills on water she was just so slow it took 10 min to come back with check but the food was really good try this place

Went here for breakfast. I had the churro French toast and it was amazing! I'm a total French toast snob and this did not disappoint. I'll be back again in May and definitely plan to come back. I docked a star as service was just okay and I was charged $5 for a tea bag and some hot water, I know it's Vegas but come on.

I came here on a Wednesday for brunch around 1PM. We initially attempted to dine at Bouchon Bistro but they apparently close at 1PM. After walking around hunting for the next best thing we settle for Grand Lux Cafe. I started off with the Ahi Ceviche: Fresh Raw Ahi Tuna Diced and Marinated in Lime Juice, Chiles and Cilantro. Tossed with Avocado, Tomato, Onion and Cucumber. This was such a refreshing and delicious dish for summer. It looked so appetizing that I forgot to take a picture of it. The appetizer was pretty hearty and you could definitely have the Ahi Ceviche as your meal. For my entree I ordered the Sonoma Saladwith Crispy Greens, Grilled Chicken, Avocado, Bacon, Fresh Corn, Sweet Dates, Golden Raisins, Onions, Goat Cheese and Glazed Walnuts. Tossed with our Hazelnut-Mustard Vinaigrette. Since it was 100+ degrees in Vegas I stuck with light dishes which turned out to be very filling. My colleague ordered a pasta and thoroughly enjoyed her entree as well. The service was quick and it was fun people watching it everyone in the casino.
